title: Thugs of Hindostan

reviews.content: Aamir Khan's acting is all that's worth watching this film. This film could have been ended just in 1 and half hour, but the directors extended the film I think just for audience. Her role in Dangal and then watching her like this is not helping just yet.

reviews.review_title: Aamir Khan shines in this big-budgeted action adventure!
reviews.content:
Hindi Films have often been guilty of plagiarism and with 2018's biggest box-office disappointment 'Thugs of Hindostan', the idea of originality in the Mumbai-Based industry was in question, once again. This action-adventure period-piece, is undoubtedly adapted from the Hollywood Blockbuster franchise of 'Pirates of the Carribbean'. But, is the film as bad as the critics and the general audience thought it is? My answer - is a NO.Sure, 'Thugs' was slaughtered ever since it's trailer released and the comparisons to Pirates, and it's setting, were of course obvious. So for originality and also for smartness, Director Vijay Krishna Acharya scores less. But is his misfire a terrible film? Absolutely not. 'Thugs' is a predictable ride, but never an unwatchable film. Its got its moments, for sure.Set in the late 1700's, 'Thugs' follows a group of Rebels known as Azaad, led by the commanding Khudabakash (Amitabh Bachchan), who must take down a vicious British Leader (Lloyd Owen). In their pursuit to defeat the British, the rebels are faced with a friend/foe in the form of Firangi Mallah (A delightful Aamir Khan), a rogue who cannot be trusted.'Thugs' is a predictable film, and sadly, barring Firangi's colourful character who changes sides every time and now, there are no surprises here. Even the character of Zafira (Fatima Sana Sheikh)
and her personal vendetta against the Villain, for having killed her family in front of her eyes, is so 1980's. However, the moments between Firangi and Khudabaksh are engaging and the joy of watching two of Indian Cinema's most respected actors coming together for the first time, cannot be denied.The biggest plus of the enterprise is Aamir's enjoyable portrayal of the anti-hero, who hits all the right-notes, be it Comedic or Sly. The action-sequences are nicely staged, but they aren't exceptional overall. Ajay-Atul's Score is superb and the Production Design is absolutely lavish. The art and costume design are top-notch, as well.The Writing by Acharya could've be stronger, for sure. Considering the amount of talent and money that has been associated with this biggie, Acharya should've made the narrative more arresting and tried on something novel. The Writing isn't bad at all though, it's by the books and works well in some parts. Acharya's Direction is decent. Cinematography is top-notch. Editing is fine, but the film feels a little too long at a 160-minutes.Of the cast, barring Aamir, no one really stands out, as they aren't given much to do. Bachchan gets a brilliant intro, but is later given limited lines and scenes, Fatima is just about okay, Katrina Kaif has just 2 songs and 3 scenes throughout the film and Owen does well. In supporting roles, Mohammad Zeeshan Ayyub does a sincere job as Firangi's friend and Ronit Roy is wasted as Zahira's father.On the whole, 'Thugs of Hindostan' isn't as bad you have heard it is, but it isn't even as good as it should've been. It's, at best, a fair watch!

reviews.review_title: Nice production design and background score
reviews.content:
Indian audience have never been kind to an ambitious period drama ever since Mughal e Azam. TOH could have been way better but considering it was made to lure the masses, it did not lack the content as advertised by many negative views.
This project had great detail to production design and background score was gripping. Fatima could have done better and dialogues could have been more impactful. Even with these shortfalls the movie is worth a decent watch and should not have been penned so horribly.

Just got through watching it, been waiting avidly for a copy of it, and well worth the wait I thought. Yes it is a bit POTC-ish, but it was still swashbuckling fun in its own way. They seemed to end it as though they may make a sequel, I hope they do, because I really enjoyed this.

reviews.review_title: Highly Entertaining Adventure Movie - Undeserving of all this Negativity
reviews.content:
Once I saw the massive number of negative reviews, I was ready to cancel my booking but then we couldn't find another movie worth watching (the other was a horror movie and we are not fans of the genre) so we decided to give it a try.The movie was almost three hours long and we did not feel bored even for a second (ok except during the songs to be honest).Common, 3.7 rating??? Worst movie ever?!! The movie is so undeserving of this negativity. It was a highly entertaining movie. We enjoyed the pace, the humor, the setting and the overall feel of the movie. Yes some stunts were obvious and weak but overall it worked. Also, I loved the bird-shots which for some reason people find laughable.
I do understand that the movie was disappointing to some, as a movie with this high budget and which for the first time ever has two of the biggest Bollywood stars meet in one movie, comes with very high expectations. I do admit that the movie was not deep enough, as I know Indians are very capable of creating complex and emotionally deep movies and plot. As I mentioned, this movie was not deep enough, it was a light adventure movie. The characters as well, were not deep or complex. That did not mean they were unlikable, no. I did like them but we did not feel emotional attachment to any of them. For example, when a major character "dies", I felt sad to see him go but not very sad. We did not shed any tears or get goosebumps during any scene in the movie. Also, at no point during the movie I felt the desire to leave. The world the movie created was great/ one that I wanted to be part of. As I said, it was a light adventure and action movie that was entertaining and fun. All three of us left the theater with a smile. The movie achieved its purpose, it entertained.
All in all, great entertainment and highly enjoyable movie. Highly Recommended. 8/10.

A great concept needs an equally skillful execution, but not every good story gets the treatment it deserves. Zero has a story with an interesting and inspiring concept that doesn't hold back with its outrageousness. This Meerut-to-Mars romance dabbles with ideas of science, interplanetary travel and closer to home, conventional themes like unrequited and undying love. In doing so, the film tries to put forth too many ideas and doesn't quite do justice to any one. Some of the visuals and romantic moments are striking, but most of them disappear as quickly as a shooting star.
The story starts off in Meerut, where Bauua Singh squanders his father's (Tigmanshu Dhulia) money while being besotted with Bollywood superstar Babita Kumari (Katrina Kaif) at all times. He is impulsive and self-absorbed, but his height hardly ever dampens his confidence. Things change dramatically when Bauua stumbles into the highly qualified scientist, Aafia's life. He's vertically-challenged and she suffers from cerebral palsy, so their shortcomings become a common ground and that creates a new space for a relationship between equals. The physical challenges aside, their personalities are also worlds apart and that eventually heightens the drama in the plot. Somewhere along, Bollywood diva Babita Kumari makes an entry into Bauua's life, adding to the drama. The film's first half is spent on setting up this unconventional romance. While the ideas are unique and appreciable, the narrative doesn't connect all the proverbial dots in the arc of the story. The plot of Zero, neither engages you, nor does it offend you.
The ideas get a lot more audacious in the second half. Bauua's love story travels to Mumbai for a fantastic tryst with Bollywood. It's here that cameos of B-town's stars surprise you and one of the obvious highlights being the coming together of the two Khans - Salman and Shah Rukh - in the song Issaqbaazi. Moving on, the story travels to the US and goes on a Mars-inspired mission, too. It's here that the graph of the movie and the characters just does not add up. The writing by Himanshu Sharma, has its moments, but it does not translate into the larger-than-life love story that it aspires to be. It swiftly goes hurtling out of orbit and at 2 hours and 25 minutes, the film definitely feels too long drawn.
The good part is that director Aanand L Rai's characters never let their physical challenges overpower their spirit and resilience. There's no rocket science to the fact that Shah Rukh pulls off romantic moments and he does that here with charm and intensity. He is excellent as the short but charismatic Bauua in a story that relies highly on special effects. Katrina Kaif appears in a smaller part, but she totally impresses in the performance of a conflicted Bollywood star, who is also heartbroken. Sadly, while Anushka Sharma's character had wonderful potential, the mannerisms employed by the actress to portray the handicap, don't always look consistent or convincing.
The same inconsistency plagues the movie, too. At one point, Zero dazzles with moments of colour and vibrancy, but then it also follows up with dull scenes that fail to launch the drama in the zone that it's supposed to be in. Some of the comedy moments between SRK and Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub stand out, so does the song Mere Naam Tu with SRK dancing in a storm of colours. While the film has a wealth of references to Bollywood and its stars, these details don't compensate for a story that starts with a beautiful plot, but takes off on a bizarre ride. At first go, the film makes you light and easy, which is good, but the problem is that it doesn't really take you on that flight of entertainment, which you set out for.

I usually never miss an Aamir Khan movie but this time I did due to health issues and time constraints. But I did manage to watch this movie on DVD and I regret not watching it on big screen. Pay no heed to negative reviews as plenty of them are baseless and they have not watched the movie at all.No, its not like Pirates at all. It may look like coz of the look and feel of the set. But thats the only similarity. I had mixed feelings bcoz of so many negative reviews when I started to watch the movie and just 5 minutes into the movie, I was in complete awe of it. Without giving much on the lines of story and screenplay, I would like to end here by giving this masterpiece an 8 out of 10 for such a visual treat.

reviews.review_title: Not even close to being as bad as some of the other disasters that's out there, eg. Dilwale, Housefull 2, Shaandaar etc.
reviews.content: I really don't understand why this movie has gotten so much hate. Just because it features a few ships, it is not a Pirates of Carribean rip-off as some people have said. It does have a few problems but they're not enough to completely derail the film and give it a 3.5/10.PROS: Aamir Khan, Amitabh Bachchan, and Fatima Sana Shaikh. While Amitabh and Fatima did not have much material, every time they were on screen, they were extremely bad-ass and extremely impressive with the stunts in their fight sequences. The two of them also have a nice character arc that I wont spoil. And Aamir Khan is always the best. Just because he acts cheerful and full of energy, doesn't mean he is Jack Sparrow as some people believe. The fight sequences are really, really well-done, especially for a Bollywood movie with amazing fight choreography, realistic looking ships (They were actually built from scratch in Malta) and outstanding visual effects. The VFX were nowhere near as bad as some people have so harshly dismissed so kudos to Vijay Krishna Acharya and DOP Manush Nandan. The background score is great. The songs could have used some work, but the background score is epic and pumps you up with adrenaline. Its generally a feel-good film. If you've had a tough or stressful week, this is the perfect popcorn entertainer that will make you laugh and keep your spirits high with terrific action sequences and good acting.CONS: The story could have been a little more complex. It is a bit generic and something we have seen before, but that does not ruin the film as some people have said. Some of the editing in the fight sequences, at times was a little choppy, but again not enough to tank and ruin the entire film. The fights were great! The characters could have been a bit more complex but the interactions between said characters and their relationships was enough to forgive the mediocre characterization. Katrina Kaif. Kind of have a feeling that the director doesnt like her too much, especially after Dhoom 3. She was pretty good with the material given, except the material was too less. The movie could have been a little shorter.All in all, it is a simple, straightforward story that feels like a summer blockbuster entertainer. Their hard-work should not be dismissed so easily and I feel that people have become very disrespectful when talking about this film. Yes, the story is not the best and there are a few character and editing problems. But the positives of this film most definitely outweigh the negatives and offers a good time in the cinema. And did I mention the stunning action sequences?

I'm certainly no expert of Bollywood films, I'm not familiar with the actresses, actors and director involved and can't compare this movie to any others of this kind. I simply watched the film at the cinema because I like epic pirate movies. The plot summary sounded intriguing, so I watched the trailer which was decent enough for me to give this film a try. I expected a good average entertaining film but what I finally got is one of the best films of the year. I neither understand nor support the numerous exaggeratedly negative reviews for this movie. Watch the trailer instead and decide whether it's decent enough for you to give this film a chance just like I did.The film starts in 1795 when the Indian subcontinent is progressively controlled by British invaders. One of the last few independent, powerful and wealthy kings gets tricked, humiliated and murdered by a ruthless British East India Company officer. His daughter survives the massacre and escapes with a veteran officer. Many years later the daughter has become a skilled fighter and the general has become the leader of a group of thugs who specialize in sea-based warfare and expose a serious challenge to the expanding British East India company. The officer in command who once killed the king wants to find the hiding place of the thugs and kill all of them. Charming, cunning and selfish criminal Firangi Mallah gets caught in this conflict and decides to take advantage of the situation by betraying both sides until his conscience finally comes into play.There are numerous elements I liked about the movie. First of all, the opening sequence is surprisingly brutal, intense and suspenseful and sets the mood for an epic tale of vengeance. Secondly, the locations look absolutely stunning throughout the entire film. Thirdly, the sound and special effects are decent and not as bad as claimed by numerous reviewers. Fourthly, the story comes around with numerous twists and turns without ever getting too exaggerated. Fifthly, the film finds the right balance between facts and fancy with its historical references and supports values such as independence, liberty and loyalty. Sixthly, the movie takes the time it needs to tell its story of epic proportions instead of rushing it and you truly get value for money if you buy a movie ticket. Seventhly, the diversified characters are particularly intriguing, especially the philosophical former veteran officer and leader of the thugs, the cold-blooded company officer and the expressive criminal. Eighthly, the acting performances are great and especially Aamir Khan is as versatile as it gets and reminds me of Johnny Depp in his best years. Ninethly, the film has several similarities to the Pirates of the Carribean franchise but is not only better than that franchise that overstayed its welcome but also adds its very own twist to it in form of the costumes, dances and locations. Tenthly and finally, I'm usually not a fan of dance and song choreographies in movies but since this element is only present on three occasions in a film with a running time of nearly three hours and gives the film its unique Bollywood identity, I actually appreciated it for once.Some people might rate my review down, not because it's badly written or because its content is useless but because they might disagree with my opinion and reasoning which only discredits these critics that already gave this film a bad name it didn't deserve. If you like epic pirate movies, you can't get around watching Thugs of Hindostan which turns out being one of the best films of its kind and one of the most entertaining movies of the year. Grab some popcorn, invite a few friends and enjoy this epic experience to the fullest.

It is an entertaining family movie with a nice plot and a lot of action. Aamir was on point as always and I loved his character. Mr. Bachchan is a legend and he's in that stage of his career by my opinion , in which it is enough for him just to be in the movie. Fatima was a delight to watch.
Someone I really liked is the girl playing young Zafira (Deshna Dugad). She's done pretty well for the small role she had and for her young age.So , in conclusion, if you are in a mood for an entertaining action , the movie will leave you with a good feeling. Give it a try.

This was the worst possible movie for Amitabh and Amir to share the screen for the first time. They deserved a lot better. .
.
Good : Amir Khan's performance. That's perhaps the only saving grace. Still, not his best work at all. The opening was fairly decent. Some parts were visually appealing. .
.
Bad : This movie is just absolutely bad. The role of Khudabaksh could've been given to any B grade actor. Bachchan was wasted as Khudabaksh. It was a shameless ripoff of Pirates of the Caribbean. Okay, I can tolerate that. But, that's not all. It has the same old Indian rebels vs Angrez storyline which has grown stale over the years, and it doesn't even try to make it more interesting. Instead, it gives us lamer version of that storyline. It also jinxed some promising characters, but like in almost every Bollywood mainstream film, it makes a parody out of it and books it completely over the top, if the initial characterization wasn't much of something called "over the top". The action scenes look super fake. There are sword fights, and not a single drop of blood. We can clearly see the swords going under the armpits (THAT'S VIJAY KRISHNA ACHARYA FOR YOU). It is too laughably bad. The character of Amir Khan feels like too much. He continues to trade sides between Angrez and Indians, to the point where it feels absolutely nauseating and to every point beyond that. You would want to scream "pleaaase, stop". There is one gigantic "twist" in the film. But, if you have seen any of these stupid masala entertainers, you can predict it. Since they won't kill of a major character, the twist becomes trivially predictable. That's how lame this is. There is no character development to understand why some characters get their mind changed, except for the fact that they wanted to include a cheap shock value. Katrina Kaif serves her usual purpose of showing her skin for some sexually appealing scenes and dancing in a semi nude costume. Other than that, she is a plot device. And her acting is too good. Even a mannequin gives more expressions than her. The story is crazy and lame. It looks too big, but is the same old stupidity. If you want to see an Angrez vs Indian film, watch "Kranti" (1981), not this garbage.Conclusion : If you are a fan of Amitabh or Amir, check out this film, because it may be the only film in which they both are together. But except for their mere presence, do not expect anything. It sucks big time. Otherwise, do anything productive. Spend your time locking yourself in the bathroom doing nothing, rather than watching this movie.Rating.Score : 0/10Grade : F

reviews.review_title: Went in with Fear. Came out with a smile.
reviews.content:

Before I watched this movie, all I heard and saw were negative reviews - which made it hard to sit on the padded sea of the cinema without prejudice for an apparently bad movie.But, I kept waiting for the movie to get slow/ stale/ boring - but it never happened!!! Thugs of Hindostan is a fantastic action flick with a production and direction team that has not been scared to take bold steps to direct the Bollywood industry to a newer, more conceptual artform.To make it really simple, I will summarize this movie in a series of highlights (pros) and dampeners (cons):Highlights:Note: First things first - this movie is nothing like Pirates of Carribean and follows it's own original theme and storyline, So, I encourage all those thinking this is a remake of Pirate of the Carrieban to please go to the cinema and o be proven wrong.1. Amitabh Bachchan has outdone himself in this role. His character is strong, uncompromising and very convincing. His acting has matured majestically with age. His role was very reminiscent of Optimus Prime in this movie in all the good ways.2. Aamir Khan always exceeds expectations in any role he is given - so much so that if a film fails, it as never because of him, but due to other factors surrounding the movie. It is hard to imagine anyone else doing this role with the ease and charisma that Aamir has done it. His coyness and personality is the base for all suspense of this movie an he portrays his uncharacteristic nature of being unpredictable beautifully in this movie.3. Background Score - The movie's background score is a perfect complement to the vibe and look of the movie. It is a sort of a beautiful amalgamation of SHerlock Holmes meets POTC meets Lagaan. It is melodic, it is engrossing and it is perfect.Dampeners (cons):1. Katrina Kaif - I feel bad that a wonderful actress who has done her part beautifully in the movie was let down by the nubile character of her role that just seems to exist to be an item number in the movie and pave the way for some racy songs.That being said, her dance was mind blowing where she was able to exhibit the levels of which he had trained for the movie. She handled some particularly daring steps an techniques with such grace and ease. But - though it was impressive, it wasn't mind blowing as it was supposed to be. It has nothing to do with Katrina's dancing or acting - but poor costume choice/ choreography that just seemed to distance itself from the music and to exhibit more skin. The songs she was in felt like such a deviation from the rest of the movie.2. Stunts involving high/ long leaps : Bollywood has reached a level of amazing graphical capabilities and this movie is one of the testaments to it. The sea, sailing, ships and action sequences were believable and did not seem too artificial like the usual Bollywood norm. But =, the industry still seems lacking to manage long and high leaps of the actors and the editing shifting into multiple shots from the time a person starts the jump to when he lands and gets up seems artificial and interfered with the flow of an otherwise good action sequence throughout the movie.Summary: ToH is a movie that is designed to entertain all the emotional aspects of the spectrum and not to be taken too seriously. It is fun for all ages and has a little bit of everything. It is a movie that will give you goosebumps at the right moments and actually manages some decent laughs due to it's sense of humor that is carried around Aamir's character.Go without expectations to the cinema and wear a sweater (as it is around 3 hours long) and you will come out with that good feeling you get when you do only one of 3 things - watching a good movie/ after having a good meal/ after emptying a full bladder.CHeers.

reviews.review_title: Indian Cinema needs to make more efforts like this
reviews.content: I've never understood the tastes of Indian audiences. I'm a 2nd generation Australian born Indian. And some of the crap that comes out of Indian Cinema is pure torture - forced humor, laughable fight scenes, cringe-inducing dialogue delivery.This movie is not one of them. It is an honest attempt at a real, authentic film. People are complaining because it's not "original" and that's reasonable... I will admit it's a little generic. But it's not a horrible film and there's a lot to admire. The visual FX, the sets, the acting, and visible passion in the films making uplifted me.Although this film is not Aamir Khan's best, it is unfair to call it "crap". Crap is pretty much most of Indian Cinema (Race, Dhoom 3, Bang Bang, Housefull, are some examples of Bollywood's many abominations). But every now and then Indian filmmakers make an honest attempt to catch up with their Hollywood counterparts. This is what this is. More Indian filmmakers need to take this route. I swear if I see another "Son or Sardar" or "Singh is Bling" I'm going to boycott Bollywood. We need to see more honest and rich films like this.

reviews.review_title: It isn't as bad as the bashing its receiving

Then my wife & I thought lets bear this flick for an hour or till intermission & leave.At intermission we asked each other "where are those unbearable demons in this movie". We found the first half engaging & decent. Second half wasnt as smooth as the first half. Especially the sequence of Manzoor-e-khuda. They were trying to create a Rajiv Rai moment of tridev & vishwatma where the lead lady dances in front of the villain & builds up the climax but that doesn't happen here hence that song & esp Kat's role was one thing that the movie could have done without. It would have helped in trimming the overall length.Aamir was flawless, his role is brilliant so is Fatima & Big B. The other flaw i felt is the Gora actors speaking hindi among themselves now had this been a Bhai movie i guess everyone would have overlooked, but Thugs being an Aamir Khan movie lets you down there coz of the standard of narration of rationality shown in Lagaan & Mangal Pandey. Music is BAD. The background score & VFX are decent.Overall Thugs is a decent movie. I wouldn't say its a must watch. You can watch it or miss it, but It surely isn't the one that deserves so much of bashing.

reviews.review_title: Vijay Krishna Achraya completes his hattrick of horrible films with Tashan, Dhoom 3 and now Thugs Of Hindostan
reviews.content: 2018 was a fantastic year for Bollywood thanks to movies like Padman, Padmaavat, Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety, Stree, Parmanu, Raid, Tumbbad, AndhDhun , Badhaai Ho etc. Unfortunate part is that we do have movies like Race 3, Namastey England which are repeated and outdone while the essence of the flavor is dying. Thugs Of Hindostan belongs to the second list which tries hard to entertain you but falls flat on the face.Thugs Of Hindostan tells the story of Khudabaksh (Amitabh Bachchan ), who fights against British empire for a free independent India. He is supported by his adopted daughter, Zafira (Fatima Sana Shaikh). Being opposed by strong army of Khudabaksh, the British Empire hires Firangi (Aamir Khan), to fight for them and defeat Khudabaksh.From the director of terrible films like Tashan and Dhoom 3, Vijay Krishna Achrya gives you yet another disappointing film. So much was expected from Thugs Of Hindostan but the lousy direction , insensible screenplay and terrible editing gives you a headache which you never asked especially from a star like Aamir Khan. The good news is that Thugs Of Hindostan is better than craps like Dhoom 3 and Tashan as it has visually appealing CGI with some amazing action sequences. I loved the background score which gels well with the mood of the film. The entry scene of Amitabh Bachchan is classy while Aamir Khan does well in the first half. However, his frequent change of party, though was nice to some extent , was leading to boredom eventually. I wanted to ask him after working hard so much for Dangal in 2016, what made him choose this script which required to prepare for 2 years.The plot is weak while the length of the film spoils the entire mood of the film. Music is another complete letdown. Art direction and cinematography is mind blowing. Amitabh Bachchan does well but does not get much scope to show his skills. Aamir Khan does raise few laughs but much was expected from the actor of his stature. Fatima Sana Shaikh does well in her role as Zafira. Katrina Kaif as usual is used for glamour purpose and is wasted.Overall, Thugs Of Hindostan is loud, lousy and unconvincing. Not recommended. 2/5

Worse movies out there that deserve the 3/10 score much more than this one. Aamir Khans acting for one was very refreshing. It was a difficult role to play, and despite some really lousy direction and dialogue, he did a fantastic job. I thought the overall story wasn't bad, the period/pirate setting was good as well (could've done without the Jack Sparrow inspiration and slaps though). But it was the direction and execution that just was of very very low quality. On top of that they were way too ambitious with CGI and action sequences given their skills, and that backfired.Overall a decent story line, fantastic acting by Aamir, but let down by terrible direction and dialogue. Aamir and the audience should probably stay away from this director as a general rule.

reviews.review_title: Not half as bad as it's being made out to be !
reviews.content: Went in with lowered expectations based on the negative reviews but found myself entertained and somewhat baffled, at least until the intermission.Baffled because contrary to what I was expecting, Aamir did not come across as a desi caricature of Jack Sparrow, Big B did not look comical playing such a role at his age, the plot, although unoriginal, was neither illogical nor confusing, the VFX, while inconsistent, was not "competing with playstation 2" and the pacing was rather swift. Entertained because the set and sound design were epic, at least by Bollywood standards, the somewhat corny but emotional scenes and dialogues were satisfying and the action sequences were convincingly choreographed.Having said this, the movie has it's flaws and takes a bit of a nose dive in the second half. Character development, in such a lengthy movie, is lacking and the sloppy editing in the second half of the movie takes a toll on the viewers. Some inexplicable annoyances such as the Britisher's torturous accents, the Falcon's refusal to once land on Big B's forearm (lol) and the casting director's decision to include a very dull and unlikable actor such as Zeeshan Ayyub take away from an otherwise entertaining package. Katrina, who ain't no Smita Patil when it comes to actings chops, plays the eye candy role well, in all but the 2.5 times we get to see her. Big B, while too wooden most of the times, bar when he abruptly becomes light-footed after a drink, carries his role with aplomb and is believable as a loyal battle worn, very very very old angry man. Aamir Khan, while overshadowed by Big B many a times, grows on you and is both likeable and charming. I personally did not find Fatima impressive. She could not pull off the dilemma of having to portray the role of a young revenge-seeking, perma-seething warrior and the potential love interest of Aamir Khan. Could not shake off the feeling that something aint right about this pairing, right after Dangal.Hyper bashing big budget movies, especially Khan movies, is a recent trend amongst critics and social media pundits. Keeping in mind the cast and the budget, yes it could have been a lot better, perhaps were it helmed by a more adept director. But do yourself a favour and go watch this movie with lowered expectations and there are good chances that you too will come out entertained and slightly baffled at the negative reviews plaguing this movie.

reviews.review_title: Good Entertainment Value!! Take a bow, Amitabh Bachchan and Aamir Khan!!
reviews.content: The huge anticipation with this movie now finally comes to an end. Although there are a whole lot of negative reviews, it is just absurd to spread this whole negativity about this movie. Maybe because people have watched too much of "Pirates of the Caribbean" series and would have expected this film to be better than that, or to beat it and other highly action-adventure "Hollywood Movies" with it, or to even compare it with the "Baahubali Franchise" is just bizarre. Every film has its own fate and it's unfair to compare such movies and thereby undermining the efforts of the people behind this movie.Of course, it may not be that "Ground-Breaking" or "Marvellous" as one would expect from an "Aamir Khan Movie" all the time but just because he's given some amazing films in the recent past which were "socially relevant". But that doesn't mean that every film of his would have a social stigma or a message attached to it. He's an actor after all at the end of the day and he carries his profession well i.e. to "entertain" the audience to the fullest.Coming to the film now, its a "fictional story" which depicts the history of India and their journey of rebellion from the rulers during the "Colonial Era". Although the plot of the film may not be "novel" or "unique", which again, is expected from an "Aamir Khan film" and if people had expected that, then it isn't the case this time. It is an "action-adventure" movie which delivers "pure entertainment".There is nothing extra in terms of "Storyline" as it revolves around the rebellion for "Freedom" but what makes the movie engaging is the high-octane drama, intense action sequences and wonderful performances!!And coming to the performances, "Aamir Khan" is just charming as always!! I think he has played his most "complex character" to date. He is just ruthless and conniving. He surprises you and even shocks you in most of the sequences but also manages to deliver chuckles and laughs simultaneously and that is the "biggest strength" of his character. "Mr.Perfectionist" perfectly dwells in his character, yet again, as always, no two opinions on that!!"Amitabh Bachchan" was, is, and will always remain a "LEGEND" for generations to come!! And he proves it to a large, large extent with this film!! Your jaw would simply drop when you would see him in action, which is just superb!! Especially the "face-off" between Aamir Khan and Amitabh Bachchan takes the movie to another level altogether!! Their chemistry is fantastic and would be remembered for a long time!! Sir, you are phenomenal!!"Katrina Kaif" has again(like "Dhoom 3") a smaller role in this film. But she is "highly effective" and a force to reckon with when it comes to "Dancing". I think she has simply "Mastered" the field of "Dancing" to another level and it's yet to be seen if any other actress would be able to match up to her dancing skills!! Kudos to her effective portrayal!!"Fatima Sana Shaikh" has an equally effective on-screen presence!! She manages to stand on her own feet in some of the sequences which is admirable!!"Mohammad Zeeshan Ayyub" comes as a wonderful surprise!!"Lloyd Owen" is decent as the "antagonist".Direction is really good when it comes to action-adventure scenes and the visual effects just enhances it further!!As far as "Soundtrack" is concerned, it doesn't have many songs but I loved "Manzoor-E-Khuda" and "Suraiyya" after that.Although the movie gets predictable at some points but it also gets unpredictable at the other. Its a good entertaining film which would be loved by the masses. Even families can enjoy it.Keeping aside the "Box-office" and "Criticism", this film has its own charm and flavour which is meant to be enjoyed and perhaps "Diwali" was the "Best Occasion" in which it got released.It may not be that good compared to other movies of "Aamir Khan" but one should remember that movies are for entertainment, and this movie delivers that!!Way better than most of the other movies which have underperformed. Hoping that it becomes a success!

reviews.review_title: It is a visual experience first of its kind in Bollywood.

Now since morning I was ready for the worst but it was not that disappointing.If you watch some movie and get a glimpse of what is about to happen just because of some spoiler or your experience you don't enjoy it that much. For me that was case. Further I don't why I dint enjoy the visuals as per my expectations but yes they were good.Tone, Script & Story: It is story of a sultanate against English Empire.Direction, Screenplay, Cinematography: Good work done with available script. I have already praised the followed areas. Music: Music is good. My favorite track is 'Suraiyya'. Acting: Justified.Final Verdict: It is a visual experience, thus u enjoy it more depending on type of screen, If you are looking for that go ahead. It is first of its kind in Bollywood.

reviews.review_title: This movie might not win any Oscars, but it is an absolute Entertainer!!!
reviews.content: Before I watched this movie, all I heard and saw were negative reviews - which made it hard to sit on the padded sea of the cinema without prejudice for an apparently bad movie.But, I kept waiting for the movie to get slow/ stale/ boring - but it never happened!!! Thugs of Hindostan is a fantastic action flick with a production and direction team that has not been scared to take bold steps to direct the Bollywood industry to a newer, more conceptual artform.To make it really simple, I will summarize this movie in a series of highlights (pros) and dampeners (cons):Highlights:Note: First things first - this movie is nothing like Pirates of Carribean and follows it's own original theme and storyline, So, I encourage all those thinking this is a remake of Pirate of the Carrieban to please go to the cinema and o be proven wrong.1. Amitabh Bachchan has outdone himself in this role. His character is strong, uncompromising and very convincing. His acting has matured majestically with age. His role was very reminiscent of Optimus Prime in this movie in all the good ways.2. Aamir Khan always exceeds expectations in any role he is given - so much so that if a film fails, it as never because of him, but due to other factors surrounding the movie. It is hard to imagine anyone else doing this role with the ease and charisma that Aamir has done it. His coyness and personality is the base for all suspense of this movie an he portrays his uncharacteristic nature of being unpredictable beautifully in this movie.3. Background Score - The movie's background score is a perfect complement to the vibe and look of the movie. It is a sort of a beautiful amalgamation of SHerlock Holmes meets POTC meets Lagaan. It is melodic, it is engrossing and it is perfect.Dampeners (cons):1. Katrina Kaif - I feel bad that a wonderful actress who has done her part beautifully in the movie was let down by the nubile character of her role that just seems to exist to be an item number in the movie and pave the way for some racy songs.That being said, her dance was mind blowing where she was able to exhibit the levels of which he had trained for the movie. She handled some particularly daring steps an techniques with such grace and ease. But - though it was impressive, it wasn't mind blowing as it was supposed to be. It has nothing to do with Katrina's dancing or acting - but poor costume choice/ choreography that just seemed to distance itself from the music and to exhibit more skin. The songs she was in felt like such a deviation from the rest of the movie.2. Stunts involving high/ long leaps : Bollywood has reached a level of amazing graphical capabilities and this movie is one of the testaments to it. The sea, sailing, ships and action sequences were believable and did not seem too artificial like the usual Bollywood norm. But =, the industry still seems lacking to manage long and high leaps of the actors and the editing shifting into multiple shots from the time a person starts the jump to when he lands and gets up seems artificial and interfered with the flow of an otherwise good action sequence throughout the movie.Summary: ToH is a movie that is designed to entertain all the emotional aspects of the spectrum and not to be taken too seriously. It is fun for all ages and has a little bit of everything. It is a movie that will give you goosebumps at the right moments and actually manages some decent laughs due to it's sense of humor that is carried around Aamir's character.Go without expectations to the cinema and wear a sweater (as it is around 3 hours long) and you will come out with that good feeling you get when you do only one of 3 things - watching a good movie/ after having a good meal/ after emptying a full bladder.CHeers.

reviews.review_title: A swashbuckling tale of action and adventure. "We must try many things but above all we must dare to fail - John Cassavetes.
reviews.content:
N kudos to Aamir for always trying something new.
I saw this film with my entire family in a theatre. This movie truly deserves to b seen on a big screen.
It was very obvious from the trailer that this film is more of a popcorn entertainment n nothing more nothing less.
The most impressive part of the movie is
the slimy character, Firangi Malla n Aamir nailed it with perfection.
They shud make a prequel on the character Firangi n a sequel based on the adventures of Firangi in England.
Aamir is great in the role, playing it with a lot of fun n energy.
Mr Bachan's screen presence is towering man. His voice, his dialogue delivery n his acting n energy level is powerful.
Is this guy on testosterone shots or creatine monohydrate?
Katrina was looking bad with her bad lip job.
Fatima cudnt deliver the dialogues properly.
The song Vashmalle is fun n the dance style n hand movements r too good. The hand movements behind the back reminded me of Shammi Kapoor.
I came home n started dancing on this song.
The action is good n intense.
Also noteworthy are the sets. They are beyond expectations and have set a level of perfection that movies in the future will struggle to achieve.

Songs and dances was awesome and i lauget a lot at Aamir Khan.

I had to stop at 55 minutes because I couldn't just take it anymore.Poor writing & direction turned the movie into a very expensive stock video. And thanks to awfully generic musical score and skill-less camera work, not a very good one.Didn't (couldn't) watch the whole movie, but I can't remember the last time where I thought Aamir Khan was difficult to watch. Amitabh Bachchan's role could have literally been replaced with a cardboard cutout. Ronit Roy's performance felt a little better, but still nothing compared to what he's capable of.In short, it didn't seem like anyone put any heart into the movie.

reviews.review_title: Thugs of Pirates of the Caribbean 😮
reviews.content:
It's the first time that two of the strongest actors in Indian cinema, Amitabh Bachchan & Aamir Khan came together for a project but what you get in return is almost 3 hrs of total disappointment. To start with, the movie is extremely long, slow, boring & lacks a good storyline. The cinematography looks like a cheap copy of Pirates of the Caribbean. Aamir Khan's himself looks like trying to pull off a Johnny Depp from the Hollywood hit. Amitabh Bachchan performance is dull and nothing you would remember the next day. Fatima Sana Shaikh is bad & I have no clue what was Katrina Kaif doing in the movie. Even her dance numbers look like a copy of the moves she had in the song Kamli. The performance of the support cast is not worth mentioning. Direction is absolutely ordinary. Songs are horrible!
The only decent thing about the movie are the last 30 minutes. The twist & turns are interesting but slowly becomes predictable. Certain dialogues are also funny.
However, the bottom line is, give this one a skip. No point spending your money on this one.
Tips for the director: India is not an Island nation! What are so many ships doing in the movie 🤔? Whatever it is, boats & ships are not & was never the primary mode of transportation within our country. Crazy!!!

reviews.review_title: JUST ANOTHER MASS FILM TO FORGET
reviews.content: THUGS OF HINDOSTAN REVIEW :Biggest Bollywood film ever, Widest Bollywood release ever, One of the Grandest Starcast assembled in this decade and what not to be excited, but what about Content? Two Legends of Bollywood Cinema comes together for Never Seen Before Action Adventure, i didn't mind with the tagline but Legends should come together for a Project which deserves to be the Valid reason of thier collaboration. Director should have thought about it, if he was bringing two legends together for the first time which is a Huge Responsibility or burden would be a good word, then he should worked carefully on Writing and Direction rather than just focussing on Action Spectacles.Thugs Of Hindostan starts on a dull note then Amitabh's entry fills the enthusiasm. Aamir's character Firangi is well written but not well executed. Action scenes are Brilliant and Grand, masses Will surely love it. Even the Background music is Excellent but it was used at some wrong moments which might irritate. The biggest problem with TOH is the pace and fashion of Storytelling where Vijay Krishna Acharya has always failed whether it is Tashan or Dhoom 3. Acting wise Aamir tries too much but the execution doesn't let him reach that height, Amitabh Bachchan has one of the best entry scene for any actor with 60+ age but again bad writing of character in 2nd half doesn't leave an impact. Fatima as Zafira fulfills the requirements of the genre. Katrina hardly has 10-12 Minutes screenspace and even those are covered by Songs. You might feel like is Katrina lost or what, does she have a Guest Appearance in this long 164 minutes screenplay? Music of the film is situational so the Video of the songs works better than audio. 'Suraiyya' is Funny and Kiddish, 'Vashmalle' and 'Manzoor E Khuda' have real situations to be watched. Cinematography is Very Good, watch out for the Action scenes from every different angle. Director Vijay Krishna Acharya repeats the same mistake again with the narrative, more than content and execution he cared about Large scale. There was no need of giving BGM to almost every scene after action finishes, there was no need of stretching the narrative to 165 minutes which could have been told in 120 minutesh with much more tight grip and impact.Overall, Thugs Of Hindostan is just made to please the mad masses and stays far away from quality. Keeping expectations on lower side has actually helped me to review this film otherwise if i look from Aamir's standard then this one is his 2nd mistake after Dhoom 3 in this decade. At Box Office it might enjoy good rushes till the festival period gets over but afterwards it will struggle big time. In Final Words, Thugs Of Hindostan is just another mass film in Bollywood to watch once, enjoy action and forget it quickly before you reach home. I am going with 4/10* same as Dhoom 3.

reviews.review_title: It's neither Pirates of Caribbean nor a Hollywood Animation movie. So don't compare it.
reviews.content:
Generally I don't write reviews because most of the times I found other reviews corrected. After watching a movie I thought to check ratings here and what I read here is totally different than what the movie is all about.First of all let me clear that here I am NOT to show sympathy to stars or director of movie.Why I gave 9:-Guys, it is not a Pirates of Caribbean so people/characters in this movie are not born for just one type of movie series.I am a big big fan of hollywood movies but I know that I should not compare Animation, VFX and effect of bollywood with hollywood. I don't know how much other reviewers here knows about VFX and all and it's technical terms.Whatever I saw in trailer it got all covered before intermission So I was really excited for second half and it was really good.Here our khudabaksh is though 76 years and his moves, expressions, feelings to plotted character is really jaw dropping. Fatima Sana Shaikh an action lady is not at all standing back of her performance. A perfect cast for her place no doubt. She was not my favourite till today. Katrina, an item for movie- play & leave. Amir Khan (not Johnny Depp). Once a Mr.Perfect always a Mr.Perfect. No need to say anything else.
Why not 10:-
1. High level story could be better instead of Old Style "taking revenge of lost family" type storyline.2. Firangi's Dialogues could be improved instead of repeating only one style of sentence.That's it from my side.Go and watch Amitabh Bachchan seen never before. A Bollywood Movie style Never seen before.Happy Diwali.

reviews.review_title: Not a good storyline but worth watching
reviews.content: I dont know why people are cursing this movie. It is not as bad to get around 3 star rating. It is a mixup of action, comedy and suspense. Aamir done his best.

A movie that can't seem to figure out whether it's an action adventure film or a musical. Seems kind of goofy when their oldest, strongest and most dangerous warrior suddenly breaks out into a song and dance routine.* Some of the worst dance choreography. Ever. One might think it was done in satire, but it was too ridiculous even for that.* Pretty good fight choreography-- for staged fights. Typical of such action films.Characters were cliche, interesting but predictable. Typical bad guy, evil to the bones. Although there's not much blood or gore, body count and violence is through the roof. Lots of stabbings, slicings and shootings.The current rating of 4.3 out of 940+ votes tells the story on this one. Adrenaline junkies might enjoy it, if they can stand the musicals. But those hurt more than the sword fights.

There has been some buzz regarding Thugs of hindusthan..not at par with the "Amir Khan film expectation"...But to me it's the best film of the year..Cinematography,Direction,Story everything makes is what gives it a hollywood feeling but in the Indian soil.Amir Khan stands out tall amongst all...followed by Big B and fateema....The two pts reduction in my review is the unnecessary silly dance inclusion of Katrina Kaif,the worst part of the film...a history has a glamour in its own terms..it has not always to be expressed in terms of a zero figured dance...though the latter one was a bit justified to the storyline...but nonetheless.thugs of hindusthan is a perfect bolly starrer and it maintains the badge of a "Amir Khan film" with due responsibility.

Personally didn't go in to the movie expecting much and unfortunately that turned out to be a true. This movie has tried to insert the feel of Pirates of the Caribbean and the style of Assasin's Creed Black flag but failed to produce a good movie due weak character motivations and predictable story and also drags a bit too long. Aamir Khan's character is the Indian version of Jack Sparrow and he has put in effort for it but due to bad writing or direction, his character tries to be unpredictable but end up predictable. Rest of the characters are the stereotypical mentor(Amitabh Bachchan), Vengeful Daughter (Fatima Shaikh), Comedy relief sidekick, and Katrina Kaif is just there. The movie may pass as entertaining for many( And it does have some moments) but for people who are only going to watch this movie on Aamir Khan's previous body of work may not enjoy this movie. As some one who has seen Pirates of the Caribbean and the much better movies of Aamir Khan I did not enjoy this movie and have wasted my money on it. So I do not recommend this movie for theater, you can watch on TV and judge for yourself then and save that money for other better movies. Also on a last side note the CGI could have been way better with the money they spent making this one.

The dynamics and the whole setup of the movie was great. With all the top actors there, I had high expectations from the movie. Although I must say that Aamir Khan' s acting was amazing. There was too much focus on special effects and zoom in moments and not enough attention to gripping story telling. Story line was good and effects were good too but all this didn't seem to gel well together. I also felt that the chemistry between the actors was superficial and not much was going on there. Aamir Khan is the only character I felt gave a heartfelt and starling performance.

reviews.review_title: Not good but not that bad too
reviews.content:
Finally after almost 3 years i watched this Aamir khan movie everybody hated when it came out, yes i agree it's not a great movie but it's not that bad too, it was enjoyable and Aamir did a great job playing his character, he was funny at times but irritating too, the story was fine but not well executed and i didn't expect more from the director tbh.
It's still sad how they wasted such a huge opportunity especially that Aamir and Big B are reunited in screen for the first time, they could've executed it in a better way with better direction.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful view of 17th century and excellent story line..
reviews.content: As I've been seeing the reviews, I still can't understand what's all the hatred and negativity about? Did you expect Thugs of Hindostan to be an offbeat film? If you did, then you're at fault since it's meant to entertain and exhilarate the viewer with its action sequences, visuals, music, comedy and fun apart from memorable characters. Thugs is a light hearted action adventure with no vulgarity or obscenity and is a film families will relish. Don't expect it to be dark or extremely serious because it never was meant to be.Among the cast, Amitabh Bachchan deserves a huge round of applause for his action hero role written efficiently. I really had goosebumps the moment he entered. His energy shows up in the action sequences and parts where he gets some of the best lines in the film. Aamir Khan has played his part very effectively. His character is surprisingly complex and his comic timing is fun. He also excels in the action sequences, and so does Fatima Sana Shaikh, who gets a lot of white knuckle action scenes to perform. Katrina is just there, but is decent. Mohd Zeeshan Ayyub evokes great laughs.Screenplay is neatly written and editing is top notch. Music is good. Action sequences are electrifying. Cinematography and visual effects are splendid.Thugs of Hindostan is meant to entertain, and it succeeds in doing that. It's a fun, colorful action-adventure epic which will not let you down. This is complete fun. I really loved it.

A "commercial film" at its best with lot of amazing visuals and great cast , especially Amir Khan and Bachan sir just stole the show with their outstanding performance and screen presence . After all it's a commercial film which doesn't demand a great script or story but it's stuffed with all elements to entertain the viewers.
I think that this movie is going to be big blockbuster my opinions.

reviews.review_title: A nice attempt that should be appreciated
reviews.content: From get go I knew that this movie has taken cues from Pirates of the Carribean and the infamous game franchise Assasin Creed: Blag Flag which initially let me down as I was expecting Bollywood own style for this movie.The movie fails to bring any original ideas to the table however it sticks to the story telling of British rule and how a group of thugs is determined to defeat them in a desk style with twists and turnsWhat keeps this movie going is not the 200 million budget but the character of Aamir Khan. He simply stole the show and breathed life into its character despite the fact it was a ripoff of Jack Sparrow.There is no doubt that VKA is a visionary director and has the guts to pull of projects like TOH, however original story and character are vital to separate Bollywood from Hollywood and to rake in fair reviews from critics and audiencesIn a nutshell this movie is a entertainer and nothing more and let me clarify this is not the worst movie of Aamir Khan. This is 10000x better than Mangal Pandey

The role of Aamir sir as Firangi was actually not so good, and too identical to Jack Sparrow. the role of Amith Sir, Katrina, and Fatima is not interesting, and just flat. for music and songs, I don't really like it. the choreography of the song "Suraiyya" really makes me uncomfortable. This might go into one of the worst Bollywood films in 2018 with Race 3. I didn't expect Mr. Perfectionist plays in this film. with a budget of more than 200 Crores, I think this film is very bad, and doesn't feature interesting stories. My prediction, maybe this film is just Flop, Average or hit, no more. I hope the audience can choose a quality film, not because there are popular actors in it. Quality is better than popularity.

Thugs is a light hearted action adventure with no vulgarity or obscenity and is a film families will relish. Katrina is just there, but is decent. Mohd Zeeshan Ayyub evokes great laughs.Screenplay is neatly written and editing is top notch. Music is good. Action sequences are electrifying. reviews.review_title: Not up to expectations but not a bad one either.
reviews.content: The movie isn't bad, all these reviews here are from other fan clubs because they usually have a compettion to degrade movies of Salman, Aamir and Srk. And as for the movie, it has a good first half with some awesome scenes, pre-interval scene was very good. Second half is about decent. The negatives in the film is the length, usually I like lengthy films but if they are long for no reason then it becomes a problem. Some scenes are way too stretched and has too many dialogues. The action, VFX, cinematography and the scale of the film is amazing. Aamir Khan is the one who mostly carries the film with his entertaining character. Amitabh Bachchan is as usual very good, his entry will give you goosebumps. Katrina Kaif is horrible. She's just there in two songs which were good songs but other than that she has 3 scenes in the whole movie and her acting is so bad in those scenes. Her lips look too big here, her mouth looked weird when she spoke. Fatima Sana Sheikh is good in the action scenes but her dialogue delivery wasn't good, was expecting a good performance after I saw her in Dangal. The background music of the film is awesome. And now coming to the direction, Vijay Krishna Acharya has made two films before this - Tashan and Dhoom 3. Now I personally didn't mind Tashan as I thought it was a good entertainer, however the film didn't do well. And I loved Dhoom 3, yes it has illogical scenes and a lot of people had issues with that film but I really liked it. Especially my first viewing of the film was an awesome experience. Now I've realised that Victor (director) is a very commercial director, he makes movies that are for entertainment. And Thugs is no different, though the film does drop pace in places, but overall it is a good time pass which can be enjoyed with family. Critics are being way too harsh on this one. Watch it for yourself and you might enjoy it. I'd give it 7/10.

Every second scene is reminiscent of sequences from the Pirates of the Caribbean. Mangal Pandey and Lagaan are masterpieces for they were original and accurate representations. Flop.

reviews.review_title: Big banners must understand- that public has grown up.
reviews.content:
When you make a movie which doesn't really have a great concept- it would have been accepted by the audience of the 90s or even 2000s, but in the recent times, the audiences have moved on. Now, the nation wants all round movies with strong storyline.Technically speaking, Bahubali was an actual epic/period film and from a technological point of view- it was almost there-
the special effects were decent,
story line was good- inspired by myths,
but the resources were managed much better.Can't say the same thing about this one. There seems to be a very clear message:
Movies are about entertainment- true, but they also are as much quality- the audience is much more intelligent their sensibilities and expectations are far different than the previous decades- if the big banners and superstars do not understand the changing expectations of the audience- there are far better alternatives in English movies- readily available at your nearest theatres and the audience will move on from Bollywood and Hollywood will profit from this.

TN.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant Movie about a less spoken piece of history
reviews.content: Without giving away any spoilers, the film does justice to the historical members it has been inspired from.With brilliant performances by all actors, the only thing that fell a tad weak would be the lack of well-timed comedic or meaningful intense dialogues. Unlike what many may think, this movie did not have any similarities to Pirates of the Caribbean. At least not intentionally. It was set in a time period where clothing and attire, were similar to PotC.Another negative would be the role of Katrina Kaif. Can't wait for the day when the need for Bollywood to continue to celebrate or depict the objectification of women. The songs itself (with Katrina) were unnecessary and didn't fit with the movie at all. I was cringing.Fortunately, the positives outweigh the negatives.The character of Zafira required the confidence of a warrior coupled with the poise of a royal. Fatima Sheik effortlessly emulated utter grace and panache in her acting skills as Zafira. Amir Khan as Firangi did wonders as always and managed to stand shoulder to shoulder with Mr. Bachchan's legendary personna. Although watching Mr. Bachchan (who is over 70 years of age) taking on a physically challenging role such as that of "Azaad", makes one want to hit the gym stat!The visual stunts looked as real as they could be and the editing was well timed. To seal the deal, the costumes and makeup were stunning.If someone were to delve into the accounts this movie is inspired from, it would help understand the filmmakers vision and creators' execution. A definite must watch.

reviews.review_title: Manage your expectations and you will be fine.
reviews.content:
THUGS OF HINDOSTAN
(Love: 3/5, an extra 0.5 included for Aamir Khan)
If you have huge expectations, managing your expectations will be the key to whether you will like the film or not.
The visual effects, cinematography, presentation and background music make it one of the best movies to come close to any big bonanza Hollywood movie, without a doubt. 1st half is good in most parts, 2nd half is strictly ok.
However, being a fantasy-adventure genre, do not attempt to find logic in the story, and you will be fine, as the screenplay gets a bit lengthy and slow at times, even giving you a 'deja-vu' of past Bollywood movies, including the song sequences. The ship sequences are stunning.
If you forgive and forget this, there is a treat waiting in the form of 'Firangi', a character which is very well written with dollops of humour and genuinely funny moments, with various plot twists-n-turns (which work to a certain extent). I went with low expectations, but found myself laughing on many occasions and Aamir is just brilliant in this act, something I had not expected. Watch it only for him !
Katrina is mainly there for the song-n-dance sequences (although she dances and acts fab, hers is more of a Guest-appearance and her fans will be disappointed, as there should have been more of her), Amitabh is a treat to watch and Fatima's performance is good but functional. Zeeshan Ayub was good, although we wanted more.
The actions sequences are good however get repetitive, music sounds jaded and faded, screenplay lengthy (people took breaks during songs), non-existent storyline and direction should have been more 'spot-on' given the scale (hence budget) of film, credibility of having a stellar cast and due to the fact that YRF backing this film.It is a movie that "could" have been a game-changer. Inspite of the criticism, one must give credit to the makers to attempt something grand in Bollywood and the effort is to be lauded. It is a one-time watch and does entertain in many parts !

For people who live off Hollywood films, this movie offers nothing new. If you have watched all the Pirates of the Caribbean films, you will find a lot of blatant copying in many shots. The only major difference in the copious amounts of emotional drama going on. In fact the effects appear amateurish even. Evidently not too many people, hours nor effort went behind the making of the effects and for a movie of this scale, you need a humongous budget to ensure every nook and cranny of the film is catered to. Unfortunately this is not the case here. A rare disappointment from Aamir Khan.

I saw this film abroad with an English friend. And we both enjoyed. It is an action film from first scene to the end continously, very hollywood style for that reason. It is also realistic to 18th century, and with wonderful visuals and poetic at times.Action plots were good as you never know what is going on in the mind of character played by Aamir in the movie. The usual bollywood emotional overdone melodrama wasn't there and usual boy singing to girl wasn't there so people need to be open to an action film set in a historic time.Katrina had not much to do other than ydance which suits the story, and the main actress is Fatima I would say. Fatima is superb and a fresh breath of energy in today's bollywood as her action sequences were amazing and suits the character who is trained just for that since childhood in the movie. She is almost in all scenes with Aamir and Amitabh. And Aamir and Amitabh played roles very well.Each scene is with action and is gripping. It is a different kind of film in bollywood. I particularly liked the introduction scene for Fatima when she along with Amitabh were pretending to be a huge statue and they start action sequence.Aamir's inner fight between being the good guy or bad guy keeps everyone guessing every moment what he would do next.And the visuals and effects were perfect as should be realistically in 18th century. It's not some fantasy movie like Pirates of Carribean or Bahuballi where things need to be larger than life as story demands that there. People should go with an open mind and appreciate for what this film is and how fun action packed sequences they have created. Amir's character may be inspired from Johny Depp, but it fits this character of film well where he is always confused about being a good guy or bad guy. When you watch the film, you see if differently.I am glad I watched the film. I just hope everyone stops following what some people started saying, and give credit to alot of hardwork put in by actors as Amitabh too, who was a pleasure to watch as you hardly get to see him do action and roles like in the younger days. I usually don't write reviews but I felt compelled to write, as a few people in media seem to have started the trend for negative feedbacks and everyone is just looking at movie with that mindset. Keep an open mind, and you will enjoy. This movie certainly doesn't deserve such backlash from public. It is very entertaining.

Thugs of Hindostan is a 2018 Indian Hindi-language epic action-adventure film, written and directed by Vijay Krishna Acharya, and produced by Aditya Chopra under his banner Yash Raj Films.
Thugs of Hindostan was released during the week of the Diwali festival, on 8 November 2018. Upon release, the film received generally negative reviews; while critics praised the performances of Bachchan and Khan, Acharya's direction and screenplay were criticized. The film recorded the highest first-day collection and highest two-day collection for any Hindi film in India, and the fourth biggest opening weekend in India. As of 13 November 2018, Thugs of Hindostan has grossed 220.19 crore($33.49 million) at the worldwide box office. It has also recovered approximately 170 crore ($26.11 million) from satellite, digital and music rights.
Action, adventure and fantasy is a genre that you associate with Hollywood's big-ticket movies. So to watch India's answer to films like Pirates Of The Caribbean, at the onset, seemed like a novel experience. While Thugs Of Hindostan has the aspirations to be a big-budget entertainer, it can't quite emulate the same thrills of a Johnny Depp swashbuckler. The film has the look and feel.of a top grade adventure film but the lacklustre writing and the tedious narrative dampens the whole experience.
The story begins in the late 1700s, where a conniving British officer named Clive deceives the honest king Mirza and dupes him off his family, life and kingdom. The young princess Zafira is the only one who escapes, along with the king's trusted guard Khudabaksh, and many years later they form a gang of pirates who are basically a bunch of goodfellas. Their only mission is to get their kingdom free from Clive and his Company rule. Thugs Of Hindostan is based during the British rule in India, when the English used their trading position to dominate India's princely states. But the fact that the heroes of this tale are pirates, doesn't quite fit into the Indian context, given that Indians never gained notoriety as pirates. The Maratha navy under leaders like Kanhoji Angre did gain bandit status during the 1700s, but Thugs Of Hindostan (TOH) doesn't quite look like it's a story emerging from the coastal regions of the country. Historical inaccuracy aside, TOH is an adventure movie and you need cinematic liberty to setup a swashbuckling story. While the production design by Sumit Basu and cinematography by Manush Nandan are excellent, the predictable nature of the writing by writer / director Vijay Krishna Acharya doesn't help the movie at all. You can guess every plot development and the fact that the movie doesn't throw up a single good surprise or twist, just rocks the boat. The tiresome screenplay features scenes that are too prolonged and overtly dramatised, as a result the story hits choppy waters. What's also funny is that the British officers speak in fluent Hindi, even when they're talking to each other.
Another disappointing aspect of the movie is the music by Ajay-Atul, that doesn't add to the narrative. While the individual performances by Aamir Khan and Amitabh Bachchan are noteworthy, the rest of the cast just never comes together. Aamir is good with the physical comedy and banter, however an Aamir Khan film generally comes with mammoth expectations, so will the disappointment of this movie leave his fans high and dry and impact his brand value, only time will tell. Mr Bachchan pulls-off the heroics and the intense dialogues well, but the rest of the cast isn't able to rally up any serious effort. Katrina Kaif is limited to two songs and a few lines of dialogue, while Fatima Sana Shaikh is left at the mercy of some badly choreographed action sequences.
Apart from the stray funny moments and consistently good visuals (thanks to decent CGI efforts), TOH doesn't really have the punch or the thrill that is required to pull off a film of this scale. At 2 hours and 45 minutes, the film feels a little too long, blame it on weak editing. The grand canvas of the film does hold sway in terms of the visual experience, but at the end, this one is all show and shallow in substance. If you are expecting TOH to give you a dose of entertainment this festive season, this one will leave you all at sea.

reviews.content: This could have been a very good movie - it had a good storyline, great acting, great everything. But I thought they injected too many unnecessary sub-plots that glorified Aamir Khan and destroyed it.

You would think that if a movie is meant to look and feel very adventurous,
then it should not be hard to make decisions based on that given concept and goal.Pros:
The acting is theatrical which fits the adventurous story very well.
Some scenes are really cinematic and very beautiful to look at.
The editing is moderately paced, which is ok I guess.Cons:
All of below doesn't let you get immersed into the story.Constant slowmotion, did not fit the adventurous and playful style and acting of the movie. Any excitement or tension that is created in a scene does not last.
The slowmotion releases every feeling that you have at that moment.
Because there is too much of it, any scene that contains tension, your sub conscience expects the slowmotion to happen, so you don't feel the tension at all.The background music did not make the scenes work,
When there was playfulness or funniness in the scene, the music was dramatic.
When there was tension in the scene or fighting, the music did not convey excitement but drama. Decisions as to where place drama filled boom notes, were very odd and almost in every scene. Suspension scenes felt like an uplifting moment. Scenes between two major character who have a tension filled dialog between them, were nullified by the music.Background music is as important as the main songs in the movie.
Just look at your favourite action scene of some movie and put a sad music below it, it does not work. The background music must help the audience get unnoticeably immersed into the story. In this movie, every scene felt like a dramatic one instead of adventurous playful, silliness tension, happy or sad one. Throughout the whole movie I can only remember dramatic background music.It is hard to belief that John Stewart Eduri and Vijay Krishna Acharya made these decisions as artists. I don't understand it.Because of the acting and cinematic shots a 5 rating.
