reviews.review_title: Gets way more thrashing than it deserves
reviews.content: To be fair, when I watched the movie in theatre I was thoroughly disappointed. Now I think that was because of the high expectations I had on an Aamir Khan starrer. I might have expected more from Mr.Perfect.But now when I rewatched it, I realized that this was a decent enough movie. I guess the major flaw in the movie was, as is the general curse of bollywood, the song sequences. Most, if not all, of the song sequence were unwanted and inconsequential. The climatic song even if was not inconsequential could have been exchanged for some other sequence. While we are at the topic of music, the background music also needed some work, especially those for Amitabh Bachan's Khudabaksh.Other than the previously mentioned, the movie was a fairly enjoyable one. Aamir Khan's character of Firangi was an obvious rip-off of Jack Sparrow. But the character had his own charm. Firangi's deceitful character kept us second guessing. Add to that Amitabh Bacchan's screen presence.This movie is not a ground breaking movie, but with a decent enough plot and genuinely well made action sequences - this movie deserve much more credit.I don't understand why filmmakers keep on casting Katrina Kaif, apart from being eye-candy, she had zero contribution to the movie.

reviews.review_title: ...A tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing
reviews.content:
IOVKA: (Rubbing his hands in glee) 'Time for my third directorial outing, Thugs of Hindostan (TOH).
EOVKA: (Horrified) 'I thought that after Dhoom 3 you would retire. After all, you almost killed the franchise!'
IOVKA: (Bristling) 'Nonsense. It was a blockbuster! You forget that I created Dhoom!
EOVKA: 'Agree, and a brilliant screenplay and story for both Dhoom and Dhoom 2. But the director was different, remember? Don't you remember your first tryst with direction- Tashan? That was almost a disaster.'
IOVKA: (Shaking his head in disagreement). 'That was because Tashan was a stylish movie before its time.'
EOVKA: '...just as TOH is after its time. It's anachronistic. I mean who is interested in swashbuckling lavish stage mounted, disjointed, surreal, in-your-face theatrics of Manmohan Desai (lord bless his soul)? And I believe that the story is based on Philip Meadows Taylor's 1839 novel, "Confessions of a Thug?"'
IOVKA: 'Nonsense. I don't even know this Meadows fellow. This is MY story. This is a period film. Remember Lagaan? It was a blockbuster! And since you do have some faith in my writing if not my direction, let me assure you that I have written this one too!'
EOVKA: 'Good Lord! Exactly and Exactly!!'
IOVKA: 'Eh?!!'
EOVKA: Exactly. Lagaan was an uprising against the British. As is this. So, what's new? In fact, this is confusing as the motives for TOH is muddled. A bit on that later. The second exactly is that I fear how your screenplay will translate on the screen....'
IOVKA: 'Eh?!!! Why?'
EOVKA: 'First, whose story is it? Is it the story of revenge of Zafira Baig (Sana Shaikh)? Or the story of Khudabaksh (Bachhan)? Or the story of Firangi? Why are you confusing the audience? Zafira wants to avenge her father's death, so her uprising is against Clive of the British. Khudabaksh seems to have a larger agenda and calls himself Azad as he purportedly wishes to free Hindostan from the clutches of the British rule. Yet your close to three-hour meandering narrative concludes with the death of Clive, without securing freedom of any kind. You didn't have to create a lofty platitude and then fail to deliver on it.
IOVKA: (Smirks). 'You have left out the story of Suraiya (Katrina).'
EOVKA: (beside itself with rage). 'Don't even get me started on the colossal waste of Katrina. She has less screen time than that damn eagle or hawk of Azad's. That was a copy from Coolie, right? What's your grouse with two perfectly capable actors anyway? Katrina is in three blink-and -you-miss me scenes, (which is highly plausible as the audience would be snoring for most of the movie) and Sana gets to speak her first dialogue forty minutes into the film! And what's with your caricatures? Amir is a poor imitation of Depp from Pirates of the Caribbean and you have, for some strange reason chosen to fashion Sana as Legolas the Elf from Tolkien's creation, with the result that she does not bloom right through the movie, unlike that fellow Orlando Bloom who played Legolas. And what's Khudabaksh's trip? Your angry old man who is smouldering rage and breathing fire right through the movie, suddenly without rhyme or reason breaks into a jig with the song Vashmalle. Was it your guilt pang that your Firangi had a lot more of colour in his character than Khudabaksh? And you didn't want to slight one thespian in favour of another? Other than Firangi to a degree, none of the other characters have been fleshed out at all despite a three-hour run of the movie! Your story is a poor potpourri of ancient plots, overused props, a dish served stale and cold.'
IOVKA: (Losing composure for the first time). 'P...people don't really care about reality, do they? And if they had such an elephantine memory, we wouldn't be able to make half the movies that we do!'
EOVKA: 'Wait, I am not done yet. You say it is a period film. The "Thug of war" between the British and the Thugs was somewhere in the 1800s. Yet you chose to plant that fellow Clive plumb in 1806, when he has died in 1774. And why do you make Englishmen speak in Hindi between themselves? Not happy with butchering history, you massacre Geography as well. Your story starts with Raunakpur which is shown as a land-locked place and yet you show an elaborate coastline and most of your action is in the waters, in the oceans in specially created ships, which have taken you what, two years to build? Yes.... Why? Why!! Who is bankrolling this excrescence, anyway?
IOVKA: (Fearfully): 'YR Films. The budget has crossed 300 crores...'
EOVKA: 'Good grief! YRF would have recovered their investment from sale of various rights...I feel sorry for the players lower down in the food chain...I am sure they will be calling you all 'Thugs of Bollywood!!'
IOVKA: 'You mean there is nothing good about the movie?'
EOVKA: 'Oh no! The movie is good looking, the background score is a hit, the players despite the flawed etching of their parts, essay them well...but it's a three hundred crore extravaganza without a soul- a colossal waste of time and resources of the industry and expectations of movie goers. Remember, it will be unleashed upon them when they would already be sated with wonderful scripts of 'Andhadhun', 'Badhai Ho' and even 'Bazaar'. It will hit them like sledgehammer and knock them cold. Pray that they recover their faith in Bollywood and the movie recovers its costs for the theatre owners and distributors before the bad publicity does it in. Shakespeare must have had TOH in mind when he described Life in 'Macbeth'.
IOVKA: 'Eh?'
EOVKA: '... Out, out, brief candle! Life's but a walking shadow, a poor player That struts and frets his hour upon the stage and then is heard no more. It is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.'IOVKA: Id of VKA
EOVKA: Ego of VKA
SEOVKA: Super Ego of VKA appears to be in a long hibernation.
(With due apologies to Sigmund Freud and Shakespeare...)

reviews.review_title: Could be better, but not bad!
reviews.content: In his modern day and age, it is sad to see that critics and expectations are completely ruining movies for people. People are not seeing movies as they normally would, but rather through the lens of hype, critics and expectations. I call this the Last Jedi syndrome. For those who haven't seen the Last Jedi, The last Jedi was a perfectly fun and exciting movie with great effects and story. It was even nominated for 5 oscars! However, people hated on it because it was not the typical Star Wars movie, and it was different than they expected. This also occurred with Thugs of Hindostan. People went in expecting the greatest Bollywood film in the last decade, with an explosive collaboration with Aamir Khan and Amitabh Bachan. This movie was just a different type of movie. It is not your regular Aamir Khan movie, with a cunning story, breathtaking acting and universal acclaim. Rather, it is an exciting summer film with great acting and gripping action. So, a word from the wise, go into this movie with low expectations, and expect a summer film. That said, it was a pretty fun and funny movie. The definite highlight was Aamir Khan as Firangi Mallah. Have fun!

reviews.review_title: I think they should have ripped off more to make Bollywood's rip off of Pirates of the Caribbean
reviews.content: I was actually interested in seeing this movie when I saw the poster at the theater. Usually when I go see Bollywood films, they are straight up action movies with the manliest of men doing feats of strength to save the world and his woman (And in-between they do a song and dance which always puts me out of the mood).The only difference between those and Thugs of Hindostan is the fact that it takes place in a Pirates of the Caribbean backdrop. It's a pretty well laid out rip off: The main protagonist is just like Jack Sparrow, he's suppose to be the hero, but you never know which side he's actually on. Although he's not as entertaining as Johnny Depp he does have his own theme music (Which actually becomes a bad running gag after a while).So this guy Firangi is a con artist hired by a British company to spy on a group of Rebels looking to overturn the empire that took over their country.The film even has it's own Elizabeth Swan in a though as nails princess who does some pretty cool movies. There's also another woman in the movie, Suraiyya who looks like she was just inserted to make up for the lack of eye candy.I am impress with the effort the film is doing. It tries hard to be an epic action adventure. Although in comparison of Pirates of the Caribbean it feels cheap, or rather closed in. It feels like it was filmed on a movie set that did not have enough space. The action scenes were not loose enough, not extravagant enough. Every one was boxed in and they really couldn't let go in the area they were filming.Despite that, I die enjoy it. something different from the Bollywood genre, but I guess it will take more money than Bollywood is willing to give to do that.

reviews.review_title: A visual/visceral/harrowing/mindboggling/swashbuckling/ramrodding IN YOUR FACE masterpiece - 223 years in the making!
reviews.content: ****POSSIBLE SPOILERS AHEAD****Thugs of Hindostan was truly an awesome film worth the wait. Yes there are a few obvious comparisons to some Hollywood characters as Aamir Khan's weirdly re-imagined larrikin stupidly renamed FIRANGI MALLAH - I must say Ameer Ali was a better choice of character name was a cross between Sherlock Holmes & Jack Sparrow. Even the music when FIRANGI enters remotely sounds like a mashup of music by Hans Zimmer, if one has a keen ear for these things. LET'S JUST call him "Sherly Sparrow" for humor's sake!!!!!! Another priceless comedy moment is the introduction of Firangi who chooses to ride on his pet donkey rather than a regal horse. Firangi's middle name should have been DHOKEBAAZ for DECEPTION is his game & AK fools the audience perfectly with his constant betrayals - at one point it becomes pretty obvious what his Modus Operandi really is. The film traces the period of 1795 to 1806 AD. One thing that was seriously misleading the audience is that from the very beginning it was Katrina Kaif who was touted as lead role #3 instead she has been relegated to some booty shaking floozy who is only good enough to sex it up for the audience and keep them wanton for lust in some fake fantasy. It seems the casting director has done KK a vast injustice simply by using her as eye candy so that nearly a billion Indian men (most with the sexual maturity of a 14 YO) will look upon this beauty with undignified lust as is the norm. In place of KK is the unknown and truthfully speaking highly unattractive actress FSS despite her being given major screen time she is nothing but a ham actor and did not do justice to her role besides screaming like some raging feminazi going through her periods. The other downside is a slightly weak plot in terms of action. The REAL ending was sadly very piss poor and it's obvious that the promoter was looking to cash in on a sequel. However the perfect ending would have been this: Lord Clive and Powell are left to fight the 3 main characters via a vicious martial arts style sword fight. Powell dies instantly at the hand of Ameer Ali aka Firangi however he finds in Clive a conniving adversary. Despite being cut by the swordsmanship of Kareem Ali and about to die; Clive brings out a pistol and shoots Ameer Ali in the heart with 3 bullets tainted with "THE POISON OF MADNESS". Its aim is to induce a mass psychosis in the victim before death. AMEER gets hit and due to his ongoing switching sides and uber-treachery learns that he has in fact redeemed himself in the eyes of Kareem Ali who he confesses with his last breath that he is Kareem Ali's only son kidnapped and enslaved by Clive n Co. Seeing his son dying in a hallucinatory vision/premonition before it ultimately happens Kareem removes the combat knife that Clive had used to kill his king aka Mirza Ali Baig (played by Ronit Roy) 11 years earlier. As soon as the bullets leave Clive's gun; Kareem in one swift martial art move let's loose the knife that goes flying in the air slow motion style and ends up decapitating Clive. THE REAL ENDING was indeed WEAK & PISS POOR. Another few pros of this masterpiece are the original score from a little known composer called John Stewart Eduri - whose music is one main positive of this film as well as the lush colors, thanks to cinematographer Manush Nandan for a flawless job done. The elaborate sets in the film make it stand like Hollywood's TROY & 300. The cinematography is faultless as are the sets. I do not know what came over me during one key scene where Khudhabhaksh aka Kareem Ali looks into the eyes of Firangi and reads his soul advising him "I SENSE THERE IS GOOD IN YOU ALTHOUGH THERE IS CONFLICT WITHIN YOUR SOUL". I found myself getting unconsciously misty eyed. That is the magic of film. Furthermore another strong point in the film are it's strong supporting cast rounded by Bollywood veteran Sharat Saxena as Maharaja Sangram Singh as well as newcomers Ronit Roy as Mirza Sikander Baig & MD Zeeshan Ayyub as the crazy sidekick Shanichar; who once again shines in a supporting role akin to his performance in last year's comedy TUBELIGHT. I give this masterpiece 9/10 for the fact that the entire team including director VKA has made a stellar effort at giving the audience something a little different. The Eagle in the film has also been conveniently nicked from another Hollywood film of repute namely KING ARTHUR. What audiences fail to see is the hard work done by actors and the entire creative team. One particular reason this film got savaged at the Indian Box Office is because the media wrongly called for opinion of AK & AB on the ME-TOO Movement, and because of their silence on the matter, Indian audience started to disrespect these 2 stalwarts and thereby causing the films potential gross to come to a halt - it matters not as Aamir's fans in China and overseas will definitely love this film. In addition there were very strong performances from Lloyd Owen as conniving Lord Clive (A tongue-in-cheek reference to actor CLIVE OWEN) and Gavin Marshall as James Powell were commanding albeit at times drastically comical with their BHINDI speak - ie British Hindi......I couldn't help but guffawing when they came onscreen as any minute they could burst into using the infamous BHINDI tagline that brits are so fond of "SUVAAR KAY BACCHAY" except the brits pronounce the first word as SOOHAR which is inherently wrong. Hahahahahaaaaaaaaaaaaaa! A well thought out film with a few flaws, but hey, no film is PERFECT. Though it's sad that Indian audiences did not warm up to the film does not take away the hard work done by all involved in the making of this masterpiece. I am hoping that Aamirji and AB saab both reunite for a sequel some time in the future for their chemistry is totally badass!!!! Just one film alone does not do justice to their chemistry. There's gotta be more as this is definitely not the end of the story. Sad to see AK now commit himself to a MAHABHARATA epic for another 10 years. A sequel cannot come soon enough. Readers, do not heed the negative reviews as some of the negative reviewers have purely boycotted the film over the me-too nonsense without giving it a chance. Gotta see this blockbuster at least once. And yes as I end this review - the end credits were awesome but once again reminded me of the film 300 - perhaps it was the animation style. Well done VKA and team. TOH2 needs to be made and if AK doesn't return, then please get SRK or ARSSK. Or even Akkibhaai Kumar will do. I, for one, was truly impressed with this film - however the film makers must be diligent and state that they have been influenced by Robert Downey Jr's portrayal of SHERLOCK HOLMES and also credit HANS ZIMMER as inspiration behind the music. A cinematographic feast for the eyes and the soul. Bollywood can be as good as Hollywood and HK Cinema, but they must remember to credit any inspirations from the past!!!!

reviews.review_title: A well balanced entertainer all the way
reviews.content: Thugs of Hindostan is an all-out entertainer that left me hooked throughout its running time. The narrative well-paced, sets grandeur, action sequences slick and the performance by the principal cast top notch. What else one expects from a film that has Amitabh Bachchan and Aamir Khan?As the movie progressed, I was impatiently waiting for Amitabh and Aamir to cross paths for the first time onscreen. And when they did, I had goosebumps. It was truly a moment to behold. Knowing the nature of both their characters in the movie and the situation when they meet, the heart-pounding tension I felt was a bonus. The cross talk they exchanged whenever they meet was pure magic. Kudos to writer-director Vijay Krishna for the brilliant screenplay.The well-staged action and above par art direction only play second fiddle to the masterful acting by both Amitabh and Aamir. I would like to throw Fatima Sana into the mix too. While Amitabh gives a poised performance as Khudabaksh, a freedom fighter who is well focused on his objectives, Aamir Khan has fun with Firangi, a devious, chameleon-like character who always kept me guessing. He twists and turns the table at the most unexpected instances. Fatima as Zafira, an expert with bows and arrows, who is hell-bent on freeing herself from her inner wounds also gives a noteworthy performance.Sadly, the only weakest link in this movie is Suraiya played by Katrina Kaif. She's only there to perform a few item songs. But every other aspect in this movie makes up for it.Englishman, Lloyd Owen as Clive, the main villain talking to his fellow Englishmen in Hindi is a real downer. If only director Vijay came up with a creative device like shifting their lingo from English to Hindi within one shot. But overall Vijay handles this historical epic steadily steering it to a rousing finale.I have a feeling this film will break records easily. Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: Old wine, old bottle: Better than Mangal Pande, though
reviews.content:
Plot as old as the hills. Nothing, absolutely nothing, New.Bad songs, with surprisingly decent picturization (in spite of the uninspiring musical composition) / choreography on the first 2.
On the other hand, the background score, initially, as well as sometimes jarring, still grew on me. A good thing.Inconsistent characterization for supporting characters, especially in the case of a sounding board for the villain, which could've been so much more (interesting), in spite of its overall inconsistency.The entirety of the characterization of the meatiest character, is so damn predictable, that even when part of it seems to get interesting during the 2nd half, giving us about 20 interesting minutes out of the interminable 165, I'd lost interest by them.Bad casting of the female lead, topped off by a really weak performance. Director and casting ppl should shoulder responsibility equally.Trojan statue copy was something novel, in spite of poor context setting. Needed more of that. With better context. Screenplay needed many more rewrites. I think ppl were in a hurry to get this made.Great end titles. Needed it in the beginning. Great art too.Weak CGI, surprisingly.
Boring action choreography. Not really bad, but boring. Nothing new.
Inconsistent sound design. Bad use of Dolby Atmos. Waste of additional ticket price.In spite of all the negatives plus all the predictability, I confess to enjoying the coming together of the main leads, and about 20 minutes in the 2nd half, including the epilogue.

reviews.review_title: A dish can get worse even if it has the best ingredients.
reviews.content:
That's the statement which can explain the movie (from my side).
Before release, it was having such great expectations (thanks to the two leads actors) and the release of trailer gave us an idea how it will be. Avid Hollywood aficionados could spot on that it's a rip off of the great great Pirates of the Carribbean but isn't. It seems instead of India, it's a Venetian story as barely there is any land visible in the movie. Always fighting on the ships, nothing else.
Two big actors collaborating for the first time became a colossal mess. Have been wasted in their roles due to a pathetic script by the great great director, Vijay Krishna Acharya who doesn't boast of any noteworthy movie. I wonder how he gets soo much money to spend and then get such huge stars to act in it. It's like misusing of one's resources.
Katrina Kaif got nothing else than dancing way worse than how she used to do in the recent past, finally she's become a poor man's Nora Fatehi (poor man in terms of talent whereas her renumeration touches the sky).
Fatima Sana Shaikh also tried her best, but when the script itself is so worst, then how can she salvage when Aamir Khan and Amitabh Bachchan themselves couldn't do.Songs? Neither worth remembering nor hummable.
Direction? Pathetic, atrociousSuggestion : do not even dare to watch this if this comes on TV. It doesn't deserve that.PS - Thank you, Mr. Vijay Krishna Acharya for such a great Diwali gift and sorry Aamir Khan you gotta taste a far worse flop than Mangal Pandey.

When the superstar of the millennium and Mr. Perfectionist come together for the first time ever, combining the histrionic experience of almost 80 years between them, you expect fireworks. Vistas of 1982 when Shakti released helming Dilip Kumar and Amitabh Bachchan marking a watershed film bloomed at the thought of being treated to pure magic.Alas, no such thing happened, thanks to the wizard called Vijay Krishna Acharya, who has given us cult classics called Tashan and Dhoom 3 in the past, we should have just known better. An expensive production of epic proportions replete with world class VFX, gloss and action sequences that are a frame to frame reproduction of Pirates of the Caribbean is what you get - but it lacks honesty, intensity and a soul. The story appears to be an afterthought being the mashup of a number of old films, and is poorly researched. Aamir Khan overacts and hams indescribably, his humour misfires. Amitabh Bachchan has a sombre role and does justice but his screen time is limited. Fatima Sana Shaikh is passable. Katrina Kaif irritates no end and her choreography and costumes (not her fault really) don't quite match the period of the setting. Only Ronit Roy makes a brilliant impact in his 10 minute role. The progress is excruciatingly slow and predictable, editing is poor and music by Ajay-Atul is forgettable. 3 STARS!!So should you give it a pass? Not at all. You shall perhaps never get to see the Big B and Aamir Khan together again - you may want to savour the experience for once, so what if the experiment by Yashraj Films fails to get critical acclaim, commercial success is a given.

Thugs of Hindostan is all time fvt..... One of the most impressive action movies I have ever seen..... The full credit goes to director and writer of movie Mr. Vijay Krishna Acharya..... The stunts leave you breathless, the acting is awsm, and the cast dynamic is better than ever..... I can't get this film out of my head, and hope Cruise and the cast get the recognition they so truly deserve..... This movie would have been just another action flick without Cruise..... The daring set pieces are well choreographed and acted in a way that looks real and genuine that puts most of this year's action blockbuster movie of Bollywood..... The soundtrack, Script, Storyline, Stunts, Special effects, opening, ending, premiere, climax, cast of characters, leading and supporting characters all are so good, exciting and entertaining..... Manzoor-e-khuda song is very unique charm to listen..... Thanx 2 Ajay - Atul Sir and John Stewart Eduri Sir for composed an Excellent track..... Vashmalle song is mind-blowing, the legends work together in this song..... My all time favorite singers Shreya Ghoshal, Sunidhi Chauhan, Sukhwinder Singh, Vishal Dadlani gives their voice to the songs and Mr. Amitabh Sir gives their voice to Lori in this movie..... Mr. Amitabh Bachahan Sir wonderfully play the role of Khudabaksh Aazad, a commander of the Thugs..... Mr. Aamir Khan Sir amazing as Firangi Mallah, a small time thug from Awadh..... Fatima Sana Sheikh as Zafira Baig, a warrior - archer Thug is fantastic, she is mind-blowing..... Katrina kaif as Suraiyya, a dancer and performer..... Lloyd owen as John Clive, a ruthless British East India Company Officer. Entire the team effort is appreciated..... The best part is watching all together Amitabh Sir, Aamir Sir and Fatima Sana Shaikh with great action scenes and their suspenseful turns..... The movie is amazing and the action scenes and the entire team work very good.... The scenes are so realistic and fantastic..... Big salute to Amitabh Sir because he phases health issues.....
And Do not miss the movie, go and watch the movie as soon as you can, It's totally worth it.....

The movie essentially revolves around a young indian princess who is orphaned at an young age , where the British ransack and kill her family. Her life's motto is vengeance fuelled with anger and this is channelised and moulded by her gaurdian , who's the army head of her kingdom. This movie reveals two sides of life Infront of us. Either we can be a strong headed ,fearless soldier who faces life's battles with a do or die attitude. On the other hand be a 'thug' and play your way through being a trickster, gamechanger and a unreliable scoundrel who eventually gets his ways by selling gossip. Either ways it is the dream of 'azad' India which brings every one together and on a journey to discover that not being trustworthy is sometimes the only option to obtain freedom. In between all this heat and war VFX , some abs flashing dance numbers makes the movie an enjoyable experience.

reviews.review_title: It's a leap forward in visual effects, action sequences and a good story-line
reviews.content:
I went to the cinema with very very low expectations, after reading so many bad reviews both from critics and public. I can't say they are completely wrong, because script of the movie was lacking but still 1/10?? very unfair!The movie overall got good direction, acting, costumes, sets, visual effects, sound and main story line and two of the best actors in Indian film industry from two different generations.
Where things went wrong is script writing, although there were few funny parts, some twists in plot here and there but mostly dialogues were very shallow. It feel some time it was rushed and some other time it was too lengthy. Sometime too many emotions with screaming and sometimes very less, but I felt the same problem with bahubali (another Indian blockbuster).Overall if you go to watch this movie just for entertainment and two reasons, you wont get disappointed
1) Amir's acting and Amitabh presence (yes, just even his presence was a good enough reason, he didn't tried too hard in this movie but still it works superbly)
2) Some nice action sequences (it's definitely behind Hollywood standards, but still much better than the main Indian action films you might have watched in recent times) and visual effects is a big step up from whatever you have seen in recent Indian films.

reviews.review_title: Thugs of Hindustan: Visual Saga without Soul Star
reviews.content: The long awaited movie turns out to be Utter nonsense and disappointing. It's unbelievably bad movie. These are the words that come to mind when you are walking out of cinema after long 2 hours and 40 minutes of watching Thugs of Hindustan. When the expectations are too high the level of dissatisfaction is even deeper and that is exactly what happens with TOH, though it was visually astounding.The writer and director, Vijay Krishna Acharya did exactly what he does in Dhoom 3, mixing ThePrestige and Now You See Me, to create an Indian mixer of film.Thugs of Hindustan is the story of a rebellious group fighting against the British East India Company. The film set in the year 1795 AD is about a Kingdom called Suraj Nagar which is ruled by generous king (Ronit Roy), who secretly try to build up an army against the East India Company rule in India. Using deceitful mean Clive, the villain (Lloyd Owen) takes over the kingdom by killing the king and queen and their son, only Zafira (Fatima Sheikh) rescued by their obedient and brave servant Khudabukhsh (Amitabh Bacchan). After 11 years, Khudabakash, Zafira with their gang (now considered thugs) started an uprising against the East India Company rule and manage to create significant unrest in the lives of the Britishers. Running short of options, Clive seeks help of Firangi Malla (Aamir Khan) to trace the whereabouts of Khudabaksh and his rebellious army. Dressed in Chameleon colour coat, that tells his devious nature Firangi is a character who is almost impossible to trust,as per his own opinion.From there it is about the chameleon trait of Aamir and whose side he actually is.To start with, the story has not much to offer, if you are a Bollywood fan and have seen movies of 80s and 90s, it can bring you nostalgia but with a sense of remix, just like the one suffered in case of Ko Ko Korina.The characters are borrowed from different films not only Hollywood but from Bollywood as well.Amitabh Bacchan character of Khudabukhsh was an amalgamation of Katappa from Bahu Bali, his own films Khuda Gawah etc. Even the name Azaad will remind you of his film Mard, in which his father's name was Azaad because the looks were quite similar. Fatima Sana Sheikh character Zafira's was borrowed from Hunger Games Katnis Everdeen, played by Jennifer Lawrence. Amir Khan character itself was highly inspired from Jack Sparrow of Pirates of the Caribbean.Aamir ostentatious performance is shackled by weak, script as he tries to be funny but he was obviously trying too hard. Amitabh Bachchan delivers what is expected from him, a powerful performance transcends. Fatima Sana Shaikh fails to leave any significant mark.And Katrina Kaif's character was more like of a cameo with two songs and a few sequences. However, she can still pull quite a large crowd for her 2 hot, sassy item songs, and voluptuous entry.Ronit Roy cameo is just so and Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub fails to impress perhaps because of bad script. To be a great hero you need a big villain, and unfortunately, Lloyd Owen as John Clive was unable to give the big villainous feel.In another words Thugs of Hindustan, is a very average film, however just like Dhoom 3 it may do well in India not because of acting but because an English General Clive who is defeated by the Indians, the hyper unrealistic portrayal certainly shows the hidden desires of the people of subcontinent.In the end Amir Khan was sailing to England to take revenge also hints a sequel.

I love period/fantasy movies. Despite the trailer of TOH not being very interesting, I gave this movie a chance. It turned out to be a very dull one. There are action scenes but they are so repetitive after a point. It's the same- characters jumping off a cliff/rope in style with loud background music and turning in slo-mo. It's all style, no substance.Amitabh B has done a good job as expected from an actor of his caliber. But everytime he is on screen, a loud background score plays out. Everytime! Like the makers know no moderation. Fatima has been given a good role- of a princess on exile. But she somehow fails to deliver. Her expressions are very one-toned. Aamir's character, his styling will instantly remind you of POTC's Capn' Jack Sparrow. His character Firangi tries to be funny but to me, it fell flat.Katrina Kaif's role and her acting is a joke. In her item numbers she dances with an incredibly flexible body but the steps are so silly that instead of looking good, it's funny. I kid you not. Surraiya (her character) is supposed to be a seductress but her dance lacks grace. It's a lot of super-flexible jumping.Zeeshan Ayub's character is introduced in a very mystic way (as someone who can "talk" to nature) but then nothing happens wrt it. In a post-interval scene, when Aamir's character does a thing to get rid of the villain's army, it will remind you of what used to happen in 70s films.The writing, the ideas are that back-dated. The writing, the flow, the consistency is so bad. The script is super lazy. It seems like hardly any effort was put. With a budget of 300 crore INR, the CGI was not good. The entire film was a major disappointment.Also- anyone notice that majority of the 10/10 reviews for TOH here on IMDB are from new users who just joined and has reviewed only this? Same happened with Veere di Wedding. IMDB is one site who's ratings influence my watching decisions. I don't approve of this tacky strategy of Production houses to bump up/manipulate the ratings.
Poop 💩, what a disappointment it's a waste of your brain . If you dare to watch this I m sure you going to shorten your about life 3 hrs. Better smoke a cigarette .

reviews.review_title: Does Not Live Up to It's Potential
reviews.content: Set in 1795, Azaad (Amitabh Bachchan) and his ward Zafira (Fatima Sana Shaikh), lead a group of resistance fighters trying to free an Indian kingdom from the British East India Company's rule. The British commander John Clive (Lloyd Owen) sends a small-time confidence trickster, Firangi Mallah (Aamir Khan), to infiltrate the band and betray them. (Katrina Kaif also stars, as dancer Suraiyya)The film has a great premise, and the first thirty minutes were quite good; sadly, the next 134 minutes were not. Instead of being exciting, funny, and enjoyable as shown in the trailer, it was mostly deadly dull. The "surprise" changes of allegiance became increasingly predictable and annoying. The action scenes are too long, as were the (average and below) musical numbers. Kaif's first number was embarrassingly ridiculous and not worthy of either her talent or dignity. Her performance, and that of Shaikh, were stiff and not natural. Owen made an exceptional villain, however. Bachchan and Khan gave strong performances, but that was not enough to redeem the entire movie. I would suggest watching the trailer, as it has all the good parts, and skipping the movie entirely.
It's a movie that demands a minus rating window in IMDB.. A 5 from me... Yes minus 5 (-5)

Feel bad for Katrina Kaif, who should be credit as special appearance rather then anything else. Fatima Sana Shaikh actions were TOO COPIED from Bahubali.
In a nutshell, the movie is ridiculously inspired from Pirates of Caribbean and Bahubali etc and so just dont even think about watching it, else you would never forgive yourself.
Vijay Krishna Acharya, please spare the world and just dont make such movies or just dont make movies AT ALL.
Big B, you are the best, just stuck in the wrong movie.
BTW all those who are rating the movie as 10 and super are fake over here at imdb. Those accounts are mostly having review for this movie only.

reviews.review_title: YRF - Where Creativity Comes to Die
reviews.content:
Yash Raj Films is a place where creativity comes to die. It is a legacy production company that has been stuck in their formulaic strategy that is celebrating its "archaicnniversary" for last 7-8 years, losing relevance in a society that is becoming smarter, sophisticated and more demanding. Sadly, they are hitting one or two decent ones here and there that justify the return of investment to continue making such clichéd films year after year.What is most disappointing about this is that seasoned actor like AK falling prey to such mediocrity. He may have possibly enjoyed taking a break from the punishing and demanding tasks of going over each and every detail of his movies but he may realize there is value in "interference" and closely-monitoring the development of his films. The money invested in this venture might be recoverable just based on number games - opening screens, reach of cinema in multiple regions and countries, one time buyers not swayed by reviews - to at least make the makers not lose sleep and their shirts for betting on this atrocity.
Hopefully, it will be a take-a-notice again call for people who continue to under look the most important part of telling the story on any media - good, crisp writing.

reviews.review_title: Amir Khan is exposed in this disaster movie.
reviews.content:
Only one thing can be said about this film and that is "pathetic".
The strory is all over the place with no viewer engagement and do not give you any perspective to the history of real thugs, who really existed. Instead director tried to take easy path and rip off from POC.
Amir Khan is totally exposed here and looks cartoonish in copying jack sparrow. His accent is absolutely rubbish. He is doing same acting since long time and is exposed every time with bad director and average story. He is simply overrated as he thrives on talent of good director and great scripts.
Amitabh Bacchhan is good as Azad and completely overshadowed Amir Khan.
Fatima Sana sheikh is ok but seems to be a bad casting choice.
And what to say about Katrina Kaif, she is wasted in this extended guest appearance. But she has looked gorgeous whenever she is on screen.
Finally coming to the main culprit and i.e director, direction is simply bad and editing is worst. Victor has made 3 films as director and all 3 are pathetic and boring (tashan, dhoom3 and TOH). Why is Yash Raj wasting so much money on him not sure.
Action scenes are good and cgi/vfx is quiet good in some places but nothing original.
Final verdict: Disappointed, these thugs do not deserve our money.

The same man fails to protect a young prince ( we are never told how he lost the prince to British) and then rescues the princess while the ruling family is slaughtered. Then becomes a leader of a rebel group that and finally teams with a con man to defeat British. The film fails to tell us why the Brits talk to each other in hindi or ...I don't know how to count the misses here.
Please don't watch it unless it's part of your ragging curriculum.

Here is a product of Bollywood, we will not say typical, but representative.The slow motion on the Indian characters is always used, without measure, in a patriotic spirit, because it is about showing the revolt of the Indians against the English occupier. The villains are English and their leader is really very mean. Indian nationalism, against the English colonizers.The colonizer hunts the Indian thugs (highwaymen). For this he gets help from Aamir Khan who helps to capture the thugs. And when he is with the Indians, he helps them to avoid the English. But by a misunderstanding he finds himself in the band of Amitabh Bachchan, charismatic leader of a band that plans to bring down the English. Aamir Khan finds himself obliged to help them (he cannot tell them, of course, that he is working for the British); but he will rally to the cause of free India, of course.Katrina Kaif stamps for the dancing and singing numbers, the first of which is pretty thanks to a deliciously vulgar choreography.The fights are very spectacular once the tethers are removed and embellished with CGI porn.The direction of the actors is without finesse: each actor and actress makes tons in his own way: first of all Aamir Khan who ensures a performance in a buffoon character who turns his jacket permanently, who is in almost every shot and makes a high-flying number (without finesse, but there is talent). But also Amitabh Bachchan in the role of a charismatic, exaggeratedly made up and with an exaggeratedly tight jaw. Fatima Sana Shaikh is monolithic (it is true that the British killed her entire family). Katrina Kaif is delicious (already mentioned) in her first choreography and her character without interest (he appears only three times, including the sequence of the epilogue): she is clearly present only for her body.But all in all this Bollywood made adventure film is spectacular, entertaining and curious.

reviews.review_title: The greatest thugs of movie making
reviews.content: Thugs of Hindostan - When the superstar of the millennium and Mr. Perfectionist come together for the first time ever, combining the histrionic experience of almost 80 years between them, you expect fireworks. Vistas of 1982 when Shakti released helming Dilip Kumar and Amitabh Bachchan marking a watershed film bloomed at the thought of being treated to pure magic.Alas, no such thing happened, thanks to the wizard called Vijay Krishna Acharya, who has given us cult classics called Tashan and Dhoom 3 in the past, we should have just known better. An expensive production of epic proportions replete with world class VFX, gloss and action sequences that are a frame to frame reproduction of Pirates of the Caribbean is what you get - but it lacks honesty, intensity and a soul. The story appears to be an afterthought being the mashup of a number of old films, and is poorly researched. Aamir Khan overacts and hams indescribably, his humour misfires. Amitabh Bachchan has a sombre role and does justice but his screen time is limited. Fatima Sana Shaikh is passable. Katrina Kaif irritates no end and her choreography and costumes (not her fault really) don't quite match the period of the setting. Only Ronit Roy makes a brilliant impact in his 10 minute role. The progress is excruciatingly slow and predictable, editing is poor and music by Ajay-Atul is forgettable. Three STARS!!So should you give it a pass? Not at all. You shall perhaps never get to see the Big B and Aamir Khan together again - you may want to savour the experience for once, so what if the experiment by Yashraj Films fails to get critical acclaim, commercial success is a given.

Thugs of Hindostan has many firsts to its credit. It is the first to feature Aamir and Amitabh together (if you do not consider anthology movies and voice acting). It is the first Bollywood sea adventure movie shot in extravagant outdoor locales. It is the first "Thugee" centric movie this century. It is also the first Pirates of the Caribbean rip-off from Bollwood.Much like like Inglourious Basterds, Thugs of Hindostan is alternate history. Set in late 18th century, it is a tale of a gang of patriotic Indian pirates/bandits standing up to the ever-expanding British East India Company. The thugs are led by Khudabaksh (Amitabh Bachchan), who conveniently calls himself Azaad. His protégé is Zafira (Fatima Sana Sheikh), a princess who he rescued from the evil clutches of Clive (John mind you, not Robert) when she was a child. Clive sends small time thug Firangi Mallah (Aamir Khan) as a spy to capture Khudabaksh.It is a swashbuckler all right, and I love the genre, period. The visual effects are perhaps the best Bollywood has seen, and the action sequences are great. Aamir and Amitabh are excellent. Everything else though is abysmal.
First- the characters. Khudabaksh is also a mishmash of epic Amitabh characters- Badshah Khan, Shahenshah, Toofan. Even Allah Rakha, the eagle from Coolie is there. What is new though is a dash of Deadpool- twin swords, and epic longevity. He is a rebel leader whose motto is that he trusts everyone. I am still scratching my head trying to understand how has he survived so long as a rebel with that belief.Firangi Mallah is the modern day double agent, and to be honest Aamir does justice to the character, balancing the dominating survival instinct with the nobler cause. However, like he did in 3 Idiots and most of his movies, he made Thugs of Hindostan all about himself. None of the other actors get much to do, all 2 hour 45 mins of the movie.The lesser said about the female characters the better. Katrina as Suraiyya is there only for 2 item numbers, and since it is the season of rip-offs, there is Fatima Sana Sheikh as a Katniss Everdeen. Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub is the comedian in the mix, but he rarely gets a line though, and the white actors ham their way through as expected.Vijay Krishna Acharya's resume will tell you that he is no auteur. However, with the talent and budgets at his disposal, I had high hopes. He kept the overall pace bearable, that's about it. Too much of Firangi, too little of everyone else was a big mistake. Too much of action with very little character development, along with a cliched and unfunny script is his other big fault. The most important piece though is probably the tone of the movie- merging high stakes patriotic intensity with Jack Sparrow inspired irreverence.Except for the background theme, music in the movie is extremely average, and that too coming from a banner that gave us blockbuster albums Kabhi Kabhi, Silsila, Chandni, Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge, Dil Toh Pagal Hai, Dhoom, Band Baaja Baaraat, and Rab Ne Bana Di Jodi.My advice- for swashbuckling fun, go ahead and watch the first Pirates of the Caribbean, and for similar alternate history patriotic glory, go ahead and watch the far better Manoj Kumar starrer Kranti.5/10 - a couple of points just for the love of Amitabh Bachchan!

reviews.review_title: Desi version of Pirates of Caribbean with pathetic script and bad music
reviews.content: Direction: After failure of Tashan and Dhoom 3, finally Vijay Krishana Acharya has completed the hat-trick of Torturous cinema. When he roped in as director, cinema lovers were so restless due his presence in this movie. First half went little bit ok but second half was totally out of track and so much predictable. He failed to encash golden opportunity like Remo in Race 3.Performance: Only one guy impressed the audience with his acting skill-None other than Amitabh Bachchan. He has done impressive action sequences in this age with heavy Armour. Another Dhoom 3 type performance from Aamir Khan as he was constantly trying to copy Captain Jack Sparrow but failed miserably. Fatima Sana Shaikh was good as Archer but not in mood of acting. Katrina Kaif was Item girl for this movie with 2 item songs. Feel sorry for Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub as he remained under utilized as per his capability. Sharat Saxena and Ronit Roy were good in cameo role. Lloyd Owen failed as villain.Script: For any cinema, script is the soul but TOH is soul-less art work which boast about Strong star cast and Big Canvas for adventurous ride but nothing works accordingly. There is so much adaptation from Hollywood flicks e.g Pirates of Caribbean, Troy so there is lack of smooth execution of script as no originality.Dialogue: After failure of Script, Dialogue was another week point of TOH. Some dialogue delivered by Amitabh Sahab was really good. Aamir's dialogues written for making audience laugh , in which he partially successful. Fatima was really not in mood to deliver dialogue as she was enjoying her angry look.Music: Atul-Ajay's music is another flop show for this movie. Not a single song make some good impression on ears. Thanks for hot performance of Katrina Kaif in two songs otherwise these two songs went unnoticed by audience. John Stewart Eduri done some wonderful job with background music.Box-Office: After making highest opening day collection of 52.75 crores, TOH earned 100 crores in 3 days. By end of first Week, 150-175 Crores will be box-office collection. As they have already gain highest Satellite rights for 150 crores. So after first week, they will start adding profit. At the end of run, it will earn the tag as Disaster from Box-office as totally production cost was 300 crores.Last Words: Wait for announcement for Lucky coupon or Offers from Yashraj Camp or multiplexes for watching this torture in cinema halls.
Aamir Khan's Worst Movie, and one of the WORST MOVIE IN 2018 with Race 3. Bad Film.

reviews.review_title: A massive disappointment of what could've been something EPIC!
reviews.content: Thugs of Hindostan is an epic disappointment but I still believe it's not as bad as some people have made it. There's been many worse films and in fact Aamir Khan has a few which would trump this!The film has too many cliches, awkward dialogues and cringe worthy moments. Too much is placed on the Aamir v Amitabh line up but in the end, neither really match up. The direction is super poor. The major positive is the action sequences. The film does have some funny and exciting moments which does make it a 'watch it once' type film but yes don't waste your money and watch it in the cinema for sure!Aamir does his best and his character comes off well at times but the majority of the time it does feel a little forceful. He is comfortable in the role, but the comedy element was lacking, especially when trying to speak English. Amitabh also does his best in a pretty flawed character but one does think why he would take such a role? Perhaps because Aamir was in it? Fatima Sana Sheikh was awful - God knows why she was casted (Aamir's recommendation no doubt) but she had no expressions whatsoever in what could've been a really career defining role. I don't see her as a leading actress that's going to do that well. Katrina does her job well - dance and look good, but she is pretty much there for eye candy and that's it.

reviews.review_title: The Biggest Disappointment of the Year
reviews.content: Picture this: the British army, surrounded and under attack, decide that it is better to watch Katrina Kaif dance than retaliate. It's an absurd and laughable moment, much like most of the movie. It pains me to say it but what should've been an epic entertainer turns out to be an epic disappointment. What hype. What a cast. What scale. And what a grand mess. Aamir Khan's first release as a leading man after 'Dangal' is a wasted opportunity through and through. Of course, the blame lies with the writer and director but we expect the world from Mr. Khan and trust his instincts. Dhoka saubhav hai mera. It didn't need to be literal.The year is 1795. The British are slowly taking over Hindostan. A few rebels, aka Thugs, aren't having it and fight back. Another thug is brought, or rather bought, in to fight those thugs. Con upon con. Battle upon battle. Time is wasted, plot holes are dug deeper, and my patience continued to be tested. The film takes a solid start. Character introductions are well thought out and Firangi (Aamir Khan) is a real treat for the first few minutes. Suraiyya is an enjoyable song and things were looking good. I was starting to believe that the story would go to great heights but it all came to a screeching halt 15 minutes before the interval. You know exactly when things go wrong and it's a sinking ship from that moment on.As I mentioned, the blame lies completely with the writer and director, Vijay Krishna Acharya. This is the same man that made 'Tashan' and 'Dhoom 3' for Yash Raj Films. Why was he allowed to lead this project? I'm looking at you, Aditya Chopra. Dhoom 3, the weakest of the Dhooms, was still a fun ride. Plagued with childish and uneven writing, this one is definitely not fun. Every twist is unconvincing and, after a point, exhausting. And other than Firangi the characters are one tone. Post interval I kept wondering how the script was okayed...by Aamir Khan of all people.Amitabh Bachchan's Khudabaksh is irritating. Even Mr. Bachchan can't save him and, honestly, it doesn't seem like he tries. His acting is surface level and when he's missing for a chunk of the movie I shrugged and said 'meh'. Fatima Sana Shaikh has only a few moments to show emotions and she's all right. I genuinely cringed at the thought of Firangi romancing Zafira. Yes, I know they're actors but give us a break! Dangal is still fresh on our minds. Do you remember Katrina Kaif's role in Dhoom 3? No? Oh because she didn't have one. She danced to a few songs and said maybe 3 sentences. Here, she doesn't even do that much. It should've been called a special appearance. The deceit keeps getting worse. Katrina looks lovely and dances like a dream in two songs but that's it. Ugh, I can't believe I am actually upset at the length of her role.Naturally the sole saving grace is Aamir Khan. He breathes life into Firangi's many layers and makes you laugh even when you want to cry from boredom. Aamir gets the tone right most of the time and is thankfully used without shame in the movie. But why does the accent slip in the confrontation scene with Khudabaksh? Surely Mr. Bachchan isn't that intimidating. In 18 years, since 'Mela', Aamir Khan hasn't faulted. He hasn't taken one step wrong hence the immense trust the audience has in him. I guess you're allowed this one mistake, Mr. Khan. But please don't repeat it.We have Hindi cinema's answer to 'Baahubali', they said. Ha! Keep trying, Bollywood. This ain't it. Annoyed, disappointed, and frankly a little pissed off. 'Thugs of Hindostan' made me feel a lot. Sitting there in the theatre, aware that the thugs were robbing us blind, we willingly let it happen. Much like the Brits I called out earlier. Can you say irony?

A fine attempt by Bollywood to emulate Pirates of the Caribbean but let's just leave it at an attempt.It felt like a crossover between Pirates & Robin Hood with Aamir as the untrustworthy conniving pirate, Capt. Jack Sparrow with a conscience, Amitabh as Capt. Barbosa & Fatima Sana Shaikh as Robin (Raveena) Hood.True to Bollywood's tradition of throwing in unnecessary song numbers, there are 3-4 annoying songs, the only benefit being relieving yourself or perhaps they thought that Katrina Kaif in raunchy outfits would save the movie. The CGI is even good ;-) to the extent of a brave eagle 🦅 flying in the midst of sword fights, gun slinging & cannon fire. Either that or the eagle must've been pumped after watching a Rajnikant film.It must've been a reunion of sorts with Amitabh acting with Sharat Saxena given the amount of films they have done together.It was interesting to watch Amitabh & Aamir especially since it's the first pairing of the mighty AAs but sadly the film should've been certified AA, Absolutely Avoidable, although post intermission it does get watchable and has interesting twists throughout. Noteworthy or not but the dances have been choreographed by Prabhudeva.

Everyone at its worst.. Actors, director, screenplay, choreography, cinematography, dialogues. Did not expect this from starcast like AB, AK, Fatima Sana, Katrina Kaif (only for dance numbers and to show her legs, not complaining)..Wonder what do they discuss when they see the final product for the first time before the release?

reviews.review_title: THUGS OF HINDOSTAN (The truth is out....AAMIR is human!)
reviews.content: Who would have ever thought that an AAMIR KHAN film will have issues with its script? But then, life is full of uncertainties, right? After starting nicely, the narrative soon goes around in circles with no surprises and hardly any interesting twists. The dialogues are good especially those between ZEESHAN AYYUB and AAMIR which induce laughter. The songs serve no purpose other than effectively breaking whatever little momentum the film manages to gather from time to time.Yash Raj Films probably thought they had struck gold by bringing AMITABH and AAMIR together for the first time. But alas, the pairing is lacklustre. In fact, it is the chemistry between AAMIR and ZEESHAN AYYUB which turns out to be the highpoint of the film.Director VIJAY KRISHNA ACHARYA tries his best but it seems he has bitten off more than he could chew. The running time at 164 minutes is way too long. In fact, it would have been a good idea to end the movie at the interval and release the second half as a sequel. The last song harks back to the Bollywood masala movies of the 80s and 90s which always had the customary climax group song/dance in the villain's lair. It is so cheesy, it is embarrassing to even watch.THUGS OF HINDOSTAN works in bits and pieces but mostly, it is akin to those faulty Diwali rockets; the ones which (once lit) whiz off anywhere with scant sense of direction and control and fizzle out in the end. Ironically, its biggest draw i.e., AAMIR KHAN is also its biggest flaw because with AAMIR, one has got used to expect the unexpected....an engrossing, almost magical experience (courtesy his brand of meaningful yet entertaining cinema).Now, we can overlook this one as an aberration but still, after coming out of the theatre, we can't help but feel THUGged (cheated)!

So you heard it all!About the Jack Sparrow like cast of Firangi Mallah (played by Aamir Khan) and a Shahenshah like cast of Khudabaksh Azaad (Amitabh Bachchan) fighting er.. teaming together for real azadi against the ubiquitous real firangees, led by John Clive (Lloyd Owen - oh yeah, here we really miss Tom Alter).While the audience meander through a 165 minutes ordeal set in 1700s, trying to wonder if it's patriotism, vengeance, deceit, fantasy, romance or naive humor(?) that drives the narration, plenty of other characters come and go - none of them leaving any impression, lasting or otherwise. Here's a script that, leave alone lacks any punch, lacks common sense either (the crucial battle being won by feeding drugged laddus to all firangi soldiers), with consequent insipid direction.Any take aways? Yes, of course. The trying to be convincing portrayals by Bachchan and Khan. Excellent cinematography and film editing - and reasonably good (albeit, lengthy) fight scenes. And a lot of lessons on how not to waste US$42Mn on a movie like this.

reviews.review_title: I am not sure what I watched
reviews.content: I went to the theater without any expectation, prejudice , comparison in mind and I was let down...I am still figuring out how many movies the director binged watch before coming with a eureka moment of making this one... Initially I thought I was watching spartan pirates of the bahubali, kulie on the great Wall... Aamir's role was heavily inspired by our very loving captain Jack Sparrow... Aamir being a great actor tried his best to pull it off and gave some moments of laughter .. the dialogues given to Amitabh were pathetic... He was given an eagle from his kulie days, the weird farming tool from dangal, the look was copied from Lord of the rings... And a miserable background score Everytime he appears on screen... Fatima Sana sheikh , poor girl didn't have much of a story... Action sequences were good but I could see Sparta fights and the great Wall fight sequences right there... Throughout the film you don't feel connected to the characters or their storylines.... The way you get all charged up for your country while watching raazi... KATRINA KAIF NEEDS SPECIAL MENTION HERE.... WHATEVER SHE WAS DOING IS NOT DANCING, HER INTRODUCTION SCENE REMINDED ME OFF PRIYANKA CHOPRA SAREE TUCKING SCENE FROM HER SONG IN RAMLEELA... PRIYANKA TUCKED HER SAREE AND MOVED ON TO ANOTHER MOVEMENT , HERE MS KAIF HELD ONTO THE KNOT LONG ENOUGH TO MAKE IT LOOK DISGRACEFUL RATHER THAN SENSUOUS ... IN HER TWO SONGS SHE DID SOME ACROBATS, SHE CAN'T DANCE... I HAD TO WATCH MADHURI DANCE FOR AN HOUR TO REPAIR MY BRAIN... SHE CAN'T ACT... GAUHAR KHAN TOO HAD A SMALL ROLE IN ISHQZAADE AND SHE MADE IT MEMORABLE... The director had no clue what to do with the film and it seems he had given up on it mid way .... One thing I would add that after watching this I believe Aamir doesn't interfer with directors or else it would have been better .

reviews.review_title: A disastrous product of taking audience granted
reviews.content:
When it comes to Amir Khan, you cant have your hopes high of quality films. Most of the movies are either remake with his mindless acting (some bloke calls it a perfectionist acting, peace for them).
This one is a Mount Everest of Copying and height of overacting.
I really don't recommend you to go to the movie. Instead buy some chips and enjoy them.
Shoddy screenpy, Mundane Action sequence, extremely lousy direction

Loosely based on Philip Meadows Taylor's 1839 novel Confessions of a Thug, the movie is set in 1795 where Khudabaksh (Amitabh bachchan) leads a band of thugs who challenge the British East India Company to control the large part of India (or Hindostan as known back then). Writer/director Vijay Acharya- fails to give the audience an engaging story line and the twists and turns are very predictable. The writer has also taken many cinematic liberty to make this 300 Cr masala VFX movie!Amir khan as Firangi Mallah - (apna desi Jack Sparrow!) has portrayed the character very well and so has Amitabh bachchan as Khudabaksh. They both got a good opening sequence (typical Bollywood formula) and most of the dialogue and punchlines.Fatima Shaikh (Zarira Baig) is fine but has hardly any limelight scene to her credits. Katrina Kaif (Suraiyya) has nothing to do but sing and dance - her role could have been well crafted (but thanks to shoddy editing and many slow motion action sequence the movie is already 3 hours long!)Music by Ajay-Atul - is below par considering there calibre and past records (Famous for Sairat). Even choreography by Prabudeva is pitiable (Amir and Amitabh looks uncomfortable and Katrina's dancing unfortunately looks out of place).Background score by John Stewart Eduri is noteworthy (the end credit has the Guy Ritche's 2009 movie 'Shrelock holmes' kinda look and feel which is awesome)The Visual effects are very good. If Aditya Chorpa had put little moolah on the story line (basis requirement) also then this movie could have been a blockbuster.Final Verdict- Can give this movie a miss (catch it on the idiot box later!). Anyways, the producers will recover the money by the mammoth amount of prints and satellite distribution. Also Amir Khan's new Chinese territory will be explored later on- and who knows- Yash raj films might be able to Thug (deceive) them too!

With top cast like Aamir Khan and Amitabh Bachchan probably one cannot make a worse movie than this and that too an attempted copy of one of the Hollywood greats !Vijay Krishna Acharya must've caused lot of pain to lot of people !!

reviews.review_title: I think people are showing a little too much hatred towards the move

The movie was not as bad as the people here are making it seem in my opinion.
Sure, there were a lot of elements of Pirates of the Carribean in the movie but what else could they have shown? That time was a time of swords and ships.
Amir khan's role was also relatable to Jack Sparrow and the Director of the movie might have even caught some ideas from POC but if you ignore to relate the move with POC, it was a fine move.
The action was not breathtaking but it seemed fine. The story was average. There were some logical holes where you say "Why did he do that when he could have just did that?" or "Is he stupid?" or "What else do they expect?"
The animation effects did not seem realistic at times but they were pretty tolerable.
Overall i did not feel bored at all but i don't count it as 170 minutes of my life traded off for total worth.

reviews.review_title: It's Entertaining. Enjoy a little and ignore the critics.
reviews.content: Just an overall entertaining movie about some scallywag pirates. What's not to like? People need to stop with their negative critiques and enjoy a few hours with the family. I was scared given the dismal 10% positive reviews on rotten tomatoes but those are overstated and perplexing. Not sure why the reviews make this sound like it's a terrible movie. Yes, It's not supposed to be an Oscar worthy picture but rather fun and a break from life, a farcical-fantasy, if you will. Lots of people took a lot of time and pains to create this.Acting is surprisingly decent. Aamir Khan has put in his all. Big B was both mysterious and had some good dialogues. It has some nice artistic scenes, which you can tell they spend a lot of money on, and great cinematography and costumes were also good. The background score is excellent. If nothing else, you can laugh at Katrina Kaif and her undulations. The fight scenes, although not always believable, were entertaining and you could tell they practiced and worked hard with the sword and arrows because they actually used them properly (unlike Padmawaat). The heroes of the film, who "save" Hindostan, are Muslim characters, maybe that had something to do with the bad reviews-after all India is weird like that.My non desi husband enjoyed the movie. Live a little and go see it. Spending a few hours and a few bucks with your family and friends won't ruin your life. All in all it was better than most of the crap Bollywood produces and it's great seeing an anti colonial movies. I think it does a great justice to Bollywood to move AWAY from the love stories. Maybe that's why desis didn't like it? No other reason why it got such bad reviews. All south Asians should be on board for that. I agree with Azaad when he says in the movie, "sometimes Indians are their worse enemy."Grab some popcorn 🍿 and enjoy.

All critics are giving negative reviews but I suggest all to go and watch the movie. The movie is well balanced and keeps one thinking if Amir khan aka farangi balla is a good guy or bad? He is no Jack Sparrow and its not fair to co.pare these two characters.Agreed that Amitabh has few dialogues and some of them being powerful once, but remember its a movie of many characters and each character is supporting the other.I read people saying Fatima was blank, I think she did justice to her character. I saw excellent facial expressions and they were not blank. I see a good actress in making. ALL THE BEST.Please go and watch the movie and then decide if critics did justice to this movie or not!!.

reviews.review_title: Thugs of Hindostan: Visual Saga without Soul
reviews.content:
Utter nonsense, so disappointing, unbelievably bad. These are the words that come to your mind when you are walking out of cinema after long 2 hours and 44 minutes of watching Thugs of Hindostan. When the expectations are too high the level of dissatisfaction is even deeper and this is exactly what happens with TOH. Visually astounding the storyline lacks soul that even mega stars can't save it.The writer and director, Vijay Krishna Acharya did exactly what he does in Dhoom 3 i.e. mixing The Prestige and Now You See Me, to create an Indian mixer of film.Thugs of Hindostan is the story of a rebel group who were fighting against the British East India Company. The film set in the year 1795 AD is about a Kingdom called Ronaq Pur which is ruled by generous king (Ronit Roy) who secretly trying to build an army against the East India Company in India. Using deceitful mean Clive, the villain (Lloyd Owen) takes over the kingdom by killing kills the king and queen and their son, only Zafira (Fatima Sheikh) rescued by their obedient and brave servant Khudabukhsh (Amitabh Bacchan). After 11 years, Khudabakash and Zafira, with their gang (now considered thugs) started an uprising against the East India Company rule and manage to create significant unrest in the lives of the Britishers. Published 3 days ago on November 12, 2018 By Hasan Kazmi
Star Rating: 2 out of 5
Utter nonsense, so disappointing, unbelievably bad. These are the words that come to your mind when you are walking out of cinema after long 2 hours and 44 minutes of watching Thugs of Hindostan. When the expectations are too high the level of dissatisfaction is even deeper and this is exactly what happens with TOH. Visually astounding the storyline is lacks soul that even mega stars can't save it.The writer and director, Vijay Krishna Acharya did exactly what he does in Dhoom 3 i.e. mixing The Prestige and Now You See Me, to create an Indian mixer of film.Thugs of Hindostan is the story of a rebel group who were fighting against the British East India Company. The film set in the year 1795 AD is about a Kingdom called Ronaq Pur which is ruled by generous king (Ronit Roy) who secretly trying to build an army against the East India Company in India. Using deceitful mean Clive, the villain (Lloyd Owen) takes over the kingdom by killing kills the king and queen and their son, only Zafira (Fatima Sheikh) rescued by their obedient and brave servant Khudabukhsh (Amitabh Bacchan). After 11 years, Khudabakash and Zafira, with their gang (now considered thugs) started an uprising against the East India Company rule and manage to create significant unrest in the lives of the Britishers. Running short of options, Clive seeks help from Firangi Malla (Aamir Khan) to trace the whereabouts of Khudabaksh and his rebellious army. Dressed in Chameleon colour coat, which tells his devious nature Firangi is a character who almost impossible to trust as according to him it is his second nature by.From there it is about the chameleon trait of Aamir and whose side he actually is.
To start with, the story has not much to offer, if you are a Bollywood fan and have seen movies of 80s and 90s, it can bring you nostalgia but with a sense of remix, just like we suffered in case of Ko Ko Korina. The characters were borrowed from different films not only from Hollywood but from Bollywood films as well.Amitabh Bacchan's character of Khudabukhsh was an amalgamation of Katappa from Bahu Bali, his own films Khuda Gawah etc. Even the name Azaad will remind you of his film Mard in which his father name was Azaad because the looks were quite similar. Fatima Sana Sheikh character Zafira's was borrowed from Hunger Games Katnis Everdeen played by Jennifer Lawrence. Amir Khan character himself was highly inspired (read copied) from Jack Sparrow of Pirates of the Caribbean.Aamir ostentatious performance was shackled by weak script as he tries to be funny but he was obviously trying too hard. Amitabh Bachchan delivers what is expected from him a powerful performance transcends. Fatima Sana Shaikh fails to leave any significant mark.And Katrina Kaif character was more like of a cameo with two songs and a few sequences. However, she can still pull quite a large crowd for her 2 hot, sassy item songs, and voluptuous entry sequence.

Utter nonsense, so disappointing, unbelievably bad. These are the words that come to your mind when you are walking out of cinema after long 2 hours and 44 minutes of watching Thugs of Hindostan. When the expectations are too high the level of dissatisfaction is even deeper and this is exactly what happens with TOH. Visually astounding the storyline is lacks soul that even mega stars can't save it.The writer and director, Vijay Krishna Acharya did exactly what he does in Dhoom 3 i.e. mixing The Prestige and Now You See Me, to create an Indian mixer of film.Thugs of Hindostan is the story of a rebel group who were fighting against the British East India Company. The film set in the year 1795 AD is about a Kingdom called Ronaq Pur which is ruled by generous king (Ronit Roy) who secretly trying to build an army against the East India Company in India. Using deceitful mean Clive, the villain (Lloyd Owen) takes over the kingdom by killing kills the king and queen and their son, only Zafira (Fatima Sheikh) rescued by their obedient and brave servant Khudabukhsh (Amitabh Bacchan). After 11 years, Khudabakash and Zafira, with their gang (now considered thugs) started an uprising against the East India Company rule and manage to create significant unrest in the lives of the Britishers. Running short of options, Clive seeks help from Firangi Malla (Aamir Khan) to trace the whereabouts of Khudabaksh and his rebellious army. Dressed in Chameleon colour coat, which tells his devious nature Firangi is a character who almost impossible to trust as according to him it is his second nature by.From there it is about the chameleon trait of Aamir and whose side he actually is.
To start with, the story has not much to offer, if you are a Bollywood fan and have seen movies of 80s and 90s, it can bring you nostalgia but with a sense of remix, just like we suffered in case of Ko Ko Korina. The characters were borrowed from different films not only from Hollywood but from Bollywood films as well.Amitabh Bacchan's character of Khudabukhsh was an amalgamation of Katappa from Bahu Bali, his own films Khuda Gawah etc. Even the name Azaad will remind you of his film Mard in which his father name was Azaad because the looks were quite similar. Fatima Sana Sheikh character Zafira's was borrowed from Hunger Games Katnis Everdeen played by Jennifer Lawrence. Amir Khan character himself was highly inspired (read copied) from Jack Sparrow of Pirates of the Caribbean.Aamir ostentatious performance was shackled by weak script as he tries to be funny but he was obviously trying too hard. Amitabh Bachchan delivers what is expected from him a powerful performance transcends. Fatima Sana Shaikh fails to leave any significant mark.And Katrina Kaif character was more like of a cameo with two songs and a few sequences. However, she can still pull quite a large crowd for her 2 hot, sassy item songs, and voluptuous entry sequence.
Ronit Roy cameo was just so and Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub fails to impress perhaps because of bad script. To be a great hero you need a big villain, and unfortunately, Lloyd Owen as John Clive was unable to give the big villainous feel.In another words Thugs of Hindostan, is a very average film, however just like Dhoom 3 it may do well in India not because of acting but because an English General Clive is defeated by the Indians, the hyper unrealistic portrayal certainly shows the hidden desires of the people of subcontinent.In the end Amir Khan was sailing to England to take revenge also hints a sequel.
Pathetic ... Sums the movie in one word. Aamir Khan, the perfectionist, has got it wrong again now. Does not seem to have learned from his previous mistake from Dhoom3.

reviews.review_title: You can watch this movie to home
reviews.content:
Let's begin this review with the fact that TOH has 'blockbuster' written over it. You like this movie or not does not matter at all, this movie is going to get a mammoth run at the box office.The best thing about this movie is that everything is so grand about it. The songs, the set designs, the cinematography, the dialogues are all 'paisa - wasool'. A perfect family entertainer, go and watch TOH in your nearby theaters (only if you are lucky enough to book a ticket).Edit:Let's see the pros and cons of the movie:Pros:(1) Amitabh Bacchan sir's stellar performance and high octane stunts.
(2) Exquisite sets.
(3) Aamir Khan's comic timing which works at times.
Cons:(1) "Adding too much masala to a food destroys it's taste"
(2) The songs,except "Manzoor - e - Khuda" are forgettable
(3) The story feels a bit strechted at times.
(4) The dialogues and set designs feel way too modern for 1795.
Rating:Story: 3 out of 5
Acting: 2.5 out of 5
Visual Appeal: 3.5 out of 5
Music: 2.5 out of 5
Screenplay: 2 out of 5Overall: 2.5 out of 5Business prediction: 240 - 260 crores at the domestic box office
(Overall: 400 crores)TOH will taste better with a bucket of "MASALA" popcorn. : )

reviews.review_title: When I understood the need for a good story over all the embellishments
reviews.content: A platform with an opportunity to see the dynamics of three interesting characters and a character which had the potential of being interesting, the main thing you focus is the discomfort you feel at every recycled shots, cliched twists, unimpressive revelation and loose ends in the story. If effort put in for the effects and the actions had been redirected to building the characters, their personalities, drives and motives, they could have achieved the scale that it was slated for. Apart from a few witty interactions, shots and dialogues and the beautiful composition of music, the movie was a huge let down. Even Mr. Bachan and Aamir Khan cannot save a movie from the story. Definitely not worth the hype that was created around it.

This movie tried to be like the hollywood blockbuster (pirates of the Caribian)but ended up failing apart,why..?? Because its not a story as the story was quite amazing.But the action sequence which were shot on multiple angles and different frame rates and ended up being mixed togethere in the same sequence,which in the end made the whole CGI flat plates to fall apart while within the sequences.the last thing is The Editor really failed in the editing.as when u take a closer look and attention,you will notice much action sequence were shot on multiple focul lengths and also different angles,but this means while in the post production you have to stick on the rule of third editing law and keep 4 or 4 shots in the 10 shots which were taken which wereCloser take
Medium take
Wide take
Aerial takeBut the Editor tried to keep much action scenes angles so as to give the film a rising hyper look but ended up looking crap and destroy the action look.The 3rd part,the CGI team tried its level best to match the CGI ships and houses with the real world footages,that was quite amazing,but the CGI ships were not correctly lightned as some of the part was really showing the ship was a CGI and also the textures and edges was quite a bit Rough.when you take a closer look on closup scenes you could actualy see the Outer strokes on subjects end marks as after mating them out from Greenscreens,the CGI should really take their game step ahead as to pay closer attention while mating out subjects and polish the stroke likes and small details.also when u look at the explosions scenes of the Ship,you will notice the same explosion as before,But thats not a big prob..!!The 4th part was.the colour correction/Grading team,also failed as many part of this movie never had same colour grade.mostly when you keep closer attentin on close shot and wide shot the colour in some Scenes were really different as it was showing Teal orange look but with Much Contrast,Then changes to Cold blue with high Green intensity,Then also changed to high contrast and shadows peaks.but in Clarity and sharpness wise,the team did perfect,but they have to process an overall same colour grade design.
Please do not watch this movie in theater. Acting was good , but the direction was very poor.
