reviews.review_title: These movies shouldn't be made in 2018
reviews.content:
I am an ardent fan of Aamir and Amitabh, and when they make such poor choices after being the cinema stalwarts that they are, I really am disappointed.I'm all for masala cheesy Bollywood movies, but good ones like Sholay or Rangeela or Amar Akbar Anthony or even Ghulam have memorable songs, quirky characters and unforgettable dialogues.
It's terribly disappointing that TOH had none of these but instead filled out 3 hours with shoddy vfx graphics, some close up action shots in slow motion and expressionless characters. Oh and did I mention, a very superficial script riddled with cinematic plot liberties and very predictable twists.
This is not Bollywood 2018. We need to stop supporting such big banner films just to make 'them' realize that what we really want is intelligent cinema, or at least something truly entertaining.All I could find myself doing throughout the movie is trying to pick up some fun lines to fit terrible scenes, for eg when katrina dances for the gora officers, I kept saying to myself ' Basanti...in kutto ke saamne mat naachna'
Oh Bollywood. I'm nostalgic for the 60s and 70s. That's timeless classic masala. Don't copy a pirates of the Caribbean, copy a Sholay instead.One star for Katrinas dance moves and another star for Aamirs enthusiasm. That's all the movie deserved.

reviews.review_title: I am glad I went without reading reviews
reviews.content:
It showed how people choose to live under colonialism: either trade in their freedom for survival, or give up their lives for what they believed in, or try to have both wealth and freedom. There is nothing wrong with any of the choices. People never should be judged by their decisions; having a free mind is not only the right but privilege that everyone deserves.
The movie indeed resembles the Pirates of the Caribbean a lot but I don't agree it is cheaper version of it. Even though there are some nonsense scenes, same things apply to POC. In my personal opinion, it is a better version of POC, the settings and customs are more beautiful and delicate. The message from the movie is much deeper than POC.
It reveals the common struggle of human nature; we always want to get ourselves full-handed but when there are too much to hold on to, we lose things here and there; when we finally let go the obsessions, the true freedom will come.
However, I don't quite like the ending that people are worshiping someone, another "ruler". But as long as they believe that is their best choice, I have no right to judge their decision.

An honest review...I watched this movie yesterday...my husband informed it's a flop, so I watched a poor and boring remake attwmpt of the well known pirates of the Caribbean... still we bought the tickets and felt we just waisting our money and time... Now a brief introduction about me, am a tough ass movie critic and I enjoy slagging off a movie... full stop ... I love it.We walked In an 3/4 empty cinema hall.and we watched the movie.... WHAT A BUNCH OF LYING CRITICS... pure crap and non sense... doesn't matter what the big newspapers write.. it's an Amir Khan,s production end of story..For those who loved the Pirates of the Caribbean, we all understand the central Character played a major role and the story line mattered... for those who wish to watch a movie were you have Pirates of the Caribbean swung in with an older days story tale casted by Amitab Bachan which chucks you back in history and adds a bag of action then this is it.. Now please understand for those seeking an average Bollywood movie with lots of booty shaking this may not be for you.. or those seeking the pretty hair styles and dresses this might not be for you. Those seeking so.e adventure go ahead you won't regret it.Amir Khan as always centralises his Character, on him self. Yes there are elements of Jack Sparrow, but Amir Khans up grade of this Character leaves you wondering what's he up to now the whole way..and leaves you applauding his cunning clever witt. Amir Khan ups the level with his Character and on only certain parts.. relating to him being slapped do the audience relate to jack sparrow.For those slightly senior citizen .. he plays an excellent role..and we'll worth the watch..it almost felt his Character was taken out of the 1990s movie and given an energy boost... what really Indian movies was about...At then end I can only say the 1/4 cinema applauded..my 4 year old loved it...and I would be happy to go again...But yes the trailer is a symbolic shamble that did no justice to the movie.. and that's why I don't wats h trailers on any movie..because they either hyper a crap movie or make a good movie look like crap..

reviews.review_title: A not so bad movie, murdered by perception and negativity
reviews.content:
This movie is a perfect case study of how marketing works and how perception of the product and word of mouth works for or against any product. So, before starting the review I also feel I should agree with the sentiments of the crowd and tone down the ratings as its a human tendency that if some strong voices create some perception about anything then generally that becomes a universal perception.
Starting my review : its a periodic and a fictional film inspired from a novel, which is again a work of fiction. The plot has nothing to do with Pirates of Caribbean, but yet some scenes have the similar look and feel. Periodic setup and Action sequences are fabulous, not matching the level of Bahubali but arguably the second best till date coming out from a Bollywood movie. Movie has many shades also from Bahubali.
Amitabh Bacchhan's work is just fine and what he does best, he did in this movie. Dialog delivery was a typical Amitabh Bachchan style.
Aamir khan captured most of the screen space and his comic timing was good and as always superb acting, towards the end his character became quite predictable and where I found this movie to bit flawed.
Fatima sana sheikh was just OK and is the lead actress of the film, suprisingly taking 95% screen space from katrina Kaif, who is there only for 2 songs and some scenes to setup these songs. In some scenes, Fatima looks a bit over excited and need to work on controlling her acting, otherwise overall she was OK.
Katrina Kaif was for 2 songs and she danced great.Action was great, Cinematography was world class. Movie could have been edited better as in second half some scenes were stretched too long.Climax of the film was very weak and again due to redundancy in Aamir's character and weak Climax, this film is getting bashed up. But honestly when you are in theatre there will be some dull moments, but barring the climax and couple of dull moments you will enjoy your time in theatre. Movie is a one time watch and a time pass and hence giving 7/10 for the enjoyable time spent, 1 point cut for not editing the movie mostly in second half, 1 for weak climax and 1 for trying to agree with generic sentiment. But frankly it's a far better than many Bollywood movies.
In the end don't fall for perception trap, watch the movie and then decide for yourself. I have seen many people trolling and bashing the movie, without even watching it, just to conform to the generic sentiment.

This movie will gather different opinion from different viewers.My ratings will be 2.9/5.Why?
Movie is extremely long. Unnecessarily songs are inserted which are not even required just to add masala like Indian Television.My recommendation to all is to take pillow with you for first 40 minutes. Extremely boring part, The movie starts after 40 minutes, you will see drama and action for next 15 minutes, after 55 minutes again movie will slow down for 20 minutes, again go to 😴 lol, just 10 minutes before intermission, movie will excites you.Dialogues delivery - somewhat comic. Sometimes it makes you laugh, sometimes feel boring.VFX - lol don't want to speak about it. Can't compare to international standards.One can watch it for - Amir Khan and Amitabh Bachchan acting or Fatima's effort or Maybe Belly Dance of Katrina or Indian movie masala or average story lineup. Story line is also predictable some times and ending is again stretched forcefully by 10 minutes.Movie is actually of 1 hr. 20 minutes and stretched to 2 hr. 45 minutes.Its the second attempt by Indian cinema after bahuballi so its worth One Time only watch.Only thing which one will not able to watch it again is Amitabh Bachchan action at this age which will take you to theatre.

reviews.review_title: One of the Best action movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: This is one of the best action movies I've ever seen. This movie is a milestone for Bollywood for me. The grand spectacles amazed me.

BEWARE - 'Thugs of Hindostan' is a very entertaining action movie worthy of 9/10 stars. When I looked at the poor reviews today morning, I was taken aback. But I enjoyed it thoroughly with my family today afternoon. The movie did not drag anywhere even though it is 2h45m - great editing. I liked it better than Dhoom3 - if that is a sensible comparison, coming from the same director. So what if it inspired in parts by 'Pirates...' - it holds it own here in India. It is a great family entertainer. Don't go by the negative reviews. See for yourself. Thanks for reading.

The movie is India's most Western attempt ever. Suffice it to say that the director actors, film crew, animation, special effects, cinematography, story line was very well crafted and put together. If you are looking for some Salman Khan and or typical Bollywood action and love triangles and mindless humour then you will surely be disappointed.
This movie is for the people who love western movies and for the people who love the artistic and the fantasy and the cinematography and the glorious nature of of films as they should be.
If you love western movies then you will love the fact that India has produced an Indian Western movie of the greatest calibre ever seen till date.Watch it with an open mind and none of the nonsense Indian presumptions. If you still didn't like it or did not understand it then clearly you belong to the Salman Khan and Shahrukh Khan and all the other typical Indian Bollywood genre. You are not a fantasy seeker nor a connoisseur of movie art.

reviews.review_title: A Decent Entertainer being bashed... 🤔Not a PK or Dangal but definitely far better than Race3 and Happy New Year
reviews.content:
Feel very bad to see a good movie getting a bad word of mouth, particularly on social media and from critics (who are rarely right)Before I write my review, I can sense why people fell in the trap of critics and negative reviews is because of the Poor Trailer.Right from the start until the interval, there's never a dull moment. AB's and Aamir's introductions are top notch and surprisingly liked the hindi of the character Clive (wish Katrina could speak as good hindi)
Suraiyya song could have been choreographed much better (It was below average)Second half starts well and holds on until another song Manzoor E khuda where again the wardrobe of Katrina is a let down and the dance too. Climax is very good (except the sweet serving part), conversation scene between Aamir and Big B is quite good.Acting:: Amitabh doing action at his age is commendable and looks his character to the T.
Aamir Khan with his performance has taken this movie to the level where you are glued to the seat throughout, His chameleon like act is flawless. One of his great performances if not the best as there are too many of those from him.
Fatima has come out as natural and true to her character. She is unbelievable in the action sequences.
Katrina didn't had much to do, she could have left an impact if the writer could have made her role a bit longer. The mainstream Bollywood critics have been successful in creating uncalled for negativity about this out and out entertainer. Like scheming villains they must be celebrating for pulling down this grand spectacle which would have otherwise collected atleast 400-500 crores.
The sheer joy of watching Amitabh Bachchan and Aamir Khan together is an unforgettable experience for any Bollywood lover. While individually both these actors are known for towering screen presence where all else just dwarfs in their presence, when they are together here they seem to complement each other and one can clearly see their mutual respect oozing out. One scene in the vashmalle dance number where both perform differently a step makes it difficult for you on where to focus your eyes...both giving perfect yet so different renditions.
The movie is indeed a visual spectacle as it tries to create a new genre of adventure/fantasy in bollywood cinema. The scale on which it is mounted is a celebration of where Bollywood movies have now reached. The action sequences are a treat to watch.
Aamir as usual is flawless as he carries the movie with his superb comic timing.
Amitabh is grand and imposing and fits the grandiose and scale of this movie perfectly.
Fatima is superb in her pivotal role and carries the action sequences with credibility and elan.
Katrina is scintillating albeit we wish she had more screen time.
The only let down one feels is that the story and screenplay does not do enough justice to the coming together of the two greatest icons of Bollywood cinema. If only Acharya had given half the time on the story to that he did for the styling, this would have been amongst the grandest Bollywood movies ever.
But surely worth a watch as is.
Have given it a 10 in reaction to the unfair/harsh criticism of spineless critics. My genuine rating is a 6.5.

Someone I really liked is the girl playing young Zafira (Deshna Dugad). She's done pretty well for the small role she had and for her young age.


PROS: Aamir Khan, Amitabh Bachchan, and Fatima Sana Shaikh. While Amitabh and Fatima did not have much material, every time they were on screen, they were extremely impressive with the stunts in their fight sequences. The two of them also have a nice character arc that I wont spoil. And Aamir Khan is always the best. Just because he acts cheerful and full of energy, doesn't mean he is Jack Sparrow as some people believe. The fight sequences are really, really well-done, especially for a Bollywood movie with amazing fight choreography, realistic looking ships and outstanding visual effects. The VFX were nowhere near as bad as some people have so harshly dismissed. The background score is great. Its generally a feel-good film. This is the perfect popcorn entertainer that will make you laugh and keep your spirits high with terrific action sequences and good acting.

CONS: The story could have been a little more complex. Some of the editing in the fight sequences, at times was a little choppy, although  were great!  The movie could have been a little shorter.

All in all, it is a simple, straightforward story that feels like a summer blockbuster entertainer. So , in conclusion, if you are in a mood for an entertaining action , the movie will leave you with a good feeling. Give it a try..

Listen.... Thugs of Hindostan is not a bad movie; a good one, as a matter of fact. My rating a 3.5/5, is supreme. Thugs of Hindostan is a fresh 'light bulb' and theme in Bollywood cinema, consisted of great acting throughout, how the story unfolded was also appreciated, as it was very enjoyable and 'you' might be surprised note this but the story was good. However, before delving into the perks of the story, Amitabh Bachchan and Aamir Khan are in pivotal roles, but as to the story, Fatima Sana Shaikh is more at centre than you think. 

With a very simple story; two thugs want to overthrow 'Clive' and his group. Since they can't because 'Clive's' army is very strong, 'Clive' hires another thug to simply brush them off. After the thug realises that one cannot just simply brush off Amitabh and Fatima (because of their relationship and strength). As a solution he decided to first falsely join forces with them and later overthrow them as an infiltrator. Continuing on with the solution the thug decided to actually join forces with Amitabh and Fatima to overthrow the 'Clive' together. 

Although each character had thier motivation, the direction should have emerged that stronger.  Duration is a big part of a movie, especially Hindi cinema, this movie was prolonged for a bit too much.

Before I watched this movie, all I heard and saw were negative reviews - which made it hard to sit on the padded sea of the cinema without prejudice for an apparently bad movie.

But, I kept waiting for the movie to get slow/ stale/ boring - but it never happened!!! Thugs of Hindostan is a fantastic action flick with a production and direction team that has not been scared to take bold steps to direct the Bollywood industry to a newer, more conceptual artform.

To make it really simple, I will summarize this movie in a series of highlights (pros) and dampeners (cons):

Highlights:

Note: First things first - this movie is nothing like Pirates of Carribean and follows it's own original theme and storyline, So, I encourage all those thinking this is a remake of Pirate of the Carrieban to please go to the cinema and o be proven wrong.

1. Amitabh Bachchan has outdone himself in this role. His character is strong, uncompromising and very convincing. His acting has matured majestically with age. His role was very reminiscent of Optimus Prime in this movie in all the good ways.

2. Aamir Khan always exceeds expectations in any role he is given - so much so that if a film fails, it as never because of him, but due to other factors surrounding the movie. It is hard to imagine anyone else doing this role with the ease and charisma that Aamir has done it. His coyness and personality is the base for all suspense of this movie an he portrays his uncharacteristic nature of being unpredictable beautifully in this movie.

3. Background Score - The movie's background score is a perfect complement to the vibe and look of the movie. It is a sort of a beautiful amalgamation of SHerlock Holmes meets POTC meets Lagaan. It is melodic, it is engrossing and it is perfect.

Dampeners (cons):

1. Katrina Kaif - I feel bad that a wonderful actress who has done her part beautifully in the movie was let down by the nubile character of her role that just seems to exist to be an item number in the movie and pave the way for some racy songs.

That being said, her dance was mind blowing where she was able to exhibit the levels of which he had trained for the movie. She handled some particularly daring steps an techniques with such grace and ease. But - though it was impressive, it wasn't mind blowing as it was supposed to be. It has nothing to do with Katrina's dancing or acting - but poor costume choice/ choreography that just seemed to distance itself from the music and to exhibit more skin. The songs she was in felt like such a deviation from the rest of the movie.

2. Stunts involving high/ long leaps : Bollywood has reached a level of amazing graphical capabilities and this movie is one of the testaments to it. The sea, sailing, ships and action sequences were believable and did not seem too artificial like the usual Bollywood norm. But =, the industry still seems lacking to manage long and high leaps of the actors and the editing shifting into multiple shots from the time a person starts the jump to when he lands and gets up seems artificial and interfered with the flow of an otherwise good action sequence throughout the movie.

Summary: ToH is a movie that is designed to entertain all the emotional aspects of the spectrum and not to be taken too seriously. It is fun for all ages and has a little bit of everything. It is a movie that will give you goosebumps at the right moments and actually manages some decent laughs due to it's sense of humor that is carried around Aamir's character.

Go without expectations to the cinema and wear a sweater (as it is around 3 hours long) and you will come out with that good feeling you get when you do only one of 3 things - watching a good movie/ after having a good meal/ after emptying a full bladder.

CHeers.

This is a review of a Bollywood movie that all Indians were excited to see, because it stars two of Bollywood's biggest and best actors, together. Imagine, HEAT with Al Pacino and Robert Dinero, and that was a classic masterpiece. This movie gets a ZERO out of 5 stars. I went to see this with so much excitement, and it was just a giant waste of time. This is 100% the director's fault. The director, Vijay Krishna Acharya is so bad, I can't believe it. I can't believe this is the same guy that directed DHOOM !! This guy should never be allowed to direct another movie again. You have two of the BEST ACTORS to ever come out of India, and you turn one into a clown, and another ...the legendary Amitabh Bachchan was shown in slow motion over and over, with no substance or great dialogue, nothing. I mean come on man!! We all wanted to see him act...not move in slow motion. What is wrong with India's director's and their obsession with slow motion, in repeat?? Who told you this is cool?? The plot is horrible...and at one point, I felt like I was watching a movie from the 80's. Katrina Kaif pretty much wears skimpy outfits, shows off her well-defined body, in vulgar dance movies which take away from the movie. The trailer makes it look like she is a lead actress, but she is basically an item number girl with two songs and very skimpy clothes with nothing of substance. I mean I could go on and on, but DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME PAYING TO WATCH THIS CRAP. Very soon this will be on TV for Free, trust me. I am sure after watching himself on screen, Amitabh Bachchan is regretting doing this movie. What a waste of a huge opportunity...two icons on India cinema on screen...and ZERO memorable scenes or dialogues. This director should never direct again. INDIAN DIRECTORS; PLEASE STOP Showing every freaken shot in slow motion....it's outdated, and not cool. TV serials all over again!!! Ok,...rant over. Go watch A STAR IS BORN or BOHEMIAN RHAPSODY Instead...you will love it. Vijay Krishna Acharya...I normally never do this, but man you wasted an opportunity of a lifetime. I guess that is what I am upset about most. AB and AK together....could have been such a huge movie!!!

Although I wound up liking this movie better than I thought I would, it's certainly not without  its serious and many flaws. It was entertaining and had some fun scenes but at the  same time the movie was a clear knock off of Pirates of the Caribbean with a little Bahubali thrown in instead of being original in any way. I went to see this movie because of the cast, especially Amitabh Bachchan , Aamir Khan and Fatima Shaikh but wish they had better material to work with. Also wondering why Katrina Kaif was in this,  she didn't really add enough to the movie to justify her role.

"Thugs of Hindostan" isn't quite as unwatchably bad as you may have heard, but I wouldn't call it a good movie either. I feel the movie has a few decent action scenes but the character development is very one dimensional. The movie comes off as a disappointment because it showcases two great actors, Aamir Khan, and Amitabh Bachchan. In their defense, I think their performances are probably the best part of this movie but it's not enough to save a messily paced story. It's far from the worst movie of 2018 but it is also far from the best, and its definitely one of the biggest let downs in recent Bollywood.

This was the worst possible movie for Amitabh and Amir to share the screen for the first time. They deserved a lot better. ..Good : Amir Khan's performance. That's perhaps the only saving grace. Still, not his best work at all. The openingThis was the worst possible movie for Amitabh and Amir to share the screen for the first time. They deserved a lot better. ..Good : Amir Khan's performance. That's perhaps the only saving grace. Still, not his best work at all. The opening was fairly decent. Some parts were visually appealing. ..Bad : This movie is just f**king bad. The role of Khudabaksh could've been given to any B grade actor. Bachchan was wasted as Khudabaksh. It was a shameless ripoff of Pirates of the Caribbean. Okay, I can tolerate that. But, that's not all. It has the same old Indian rebels vs Angrez storyline which has grown stale over the years, and it doesn't even try to make it more interesting. Instead, it gives us lamer version of that storyline. It also jinxed some promising characters, but like in almost every Bollywood mainstream film, it makes a parody out of it and books it completely over the top, if the initial characterization wasn't much of something called "over the top". The action scenes look super fake. There are sword fights, and not a single drop of blood. We can clearly see the swords going under the armpits (THAT'S VIJAY KRISHNA ACHARYA FOR YOU). It is too laughably bad. The character of Amir Khan feels like too much. He continues to trade sides between Angrez and Indians, to the point where it feels absolutely nauseating and to every point beyond that. You would want to scream "pleaaase, stop". There is one gigantic "twist" in the film. But, if you have seen any of these stupid masala entertainers, you can predict it. Since they won't kill of a major character, the twist becomes trivially predictable. That's how lame this piece of s**t is. There is no character development to understand why some characters get their mind changed, except for the fact that they wanted to include a cheap shock value. Katrina Kaif serves her usual purpose of showing her skin for some sexually appealing scenes and dancing in a semi nude costume. Other than that, she is a plot device. And her acting is too good. Even a mannequin gives more expressions than her. The story is crazy and lame. It looks too big, but is the same old s**t. If you want to see an Angrez vs Indian film, watch "Kranti" (1981), not this garbage. ..Conclusion : If you are a fan of Amitabh or Amir, check out this film, because it may be the only film in which they both are together. But except for their mere presence, do not expect anything. It sucks big time. Otherwise, do anything productive. Spend your time locking yourself in the bathroom doing nothing, rather than watching this rat's a$$ of a movie. ..Rating. ..Score : 0/10Grade : F
